loans.name: Zarka

texts.en: Zarka is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Zarka’s husband, who is a driver by profession; he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Zarka has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zarka is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some spare parts.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, age 18, is a married woman. She has been running a business selling eggs with her husband (also shown in the photo). He sells from his motorcycle to the people of their community and also supplies the local market. They earn a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, Zahida applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees. She intends to use this loan to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity to inflate their sales. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity to inflate their sales.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 23 years old. He lives with his mother in the village of Vazashen in Tavush region. This young man has no higher education, but takes care of his small family through agriculture and hired construction work from time to time. 

On his farm he has only one cow, but he has a large amount of land, where he has many fruit trees (apple, fig, persimmon, pear, mulberry, quince, etc.). He also cultivates vegetables (tomato, cucumber, pepper, beans, etc.) and wheat. All these he sells right from his house to resellers. As he says, he likes this way of living and he likes these farming activities. They would be perfect if he managed to have a little bit more income as the result of his hard work.

Artur asks for a loan because he wants to make his farm bigger and to buy three piglets and fodder for them and his single cow.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and fodder for them and his cow

loans.name: María Piedad

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
María es agricultora, siembra papas, habas, también se dedica a la producción de queso. Solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca y así producir queso. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana, y la venta del producto 2 veces por semana. Su meta es tener una familia y 10 cabezas de ganado. Su desafío son la lluvia y las heladas. En su tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the Manzanapamba community, which is in Guaranda canton, Bolívar Province.

She is a member of Manzanapamba community bank, which is made up of 10 members who are from the same community, and who make their living in agriculture. She lives 30 minutes from the Guaranda central office.

María is a farmer. She grows potatoes and broad beans, and also makes cheese. She is applying for this loan to buy a cow to be able to make cheese. She makes her purchases in Guaranda every week, and sells her products twice a week.

Her goal is to have a family and 10 heads of cattle. Her greatest challenges are the rain and the freezes.

In her free time, she likes to clean her house. The custom she likes most is Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Gyumri with her two daughters, son and husband. Alvard is involved in a retail business. She sells clothing and dressmaking supplies in Gyumri town and in nearby villages. Her children are grown up and work hard to sustain their familes' living. 

Alvard herself runs her business with big love and care towards her clients. Now, by applying for this loan, Alvard asks financial support to be able to purchase new stock of clothing to sell to her clients. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will be a great support for this hardworking woman and she will be very grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Shanaze

texts.en:
Shanaze is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Shanaze has gradually improved her business; currently she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz, age 42, is a married woman. She sells fabrics. She buys lengths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Shanaz is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of fabrics in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of fabrics in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is 29 years old and he lives with his mother in the city of Dilijan. He has graduated from an academy of fine arts. Despite having great talent for painting, Edvard has not managed to find a good job. For several years he worked as a construction worker. Now he is also engaged in entirely different work far from his specialty; he works at the Dilijan sanatorium as a cook. Edvard is the only breadwinner in his family since his mother is already retired.

Edvard has asked for a loan since he wants very much to have a computer. Because of his lack of money, it has become a kind of a dream for him, but being informed about Kiva, he hopes that soon his dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha works hard to ensure her business runs well. She appreciates her previous loan, which helped her to buy materials for weaving roofing material. Here again she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for weaving roofing. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave roofing material

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is proud to be associated with UGAFODE and thanks the Kiva lenders for the good job they did for him on the previous loan. He was able to continue with the construction of his family house and thinks that very soon his children will enjoy modest housing. He hopes to acquire another loan soon to complete it. He pledges to maintain his good relationship with Kiva. In the photograph is John with the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Bahati has operated a business of selling makuti (roofing materials) for the past three years, selling at the market to passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy more raw roofing materials for sale as she already has customers. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more raw roofing materials for sale

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now, she requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region. She is married and she has a son and a daughter. Susanna works at the kindergarten, but together with all her family members, she is engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm she takes care of 10 cows, 20 chickens and a horse. On her plot of land she cultivates vegetables and from her large fruit garden she gathers very tasty and nice fruits (apples, persimmons, figs, etc.). She sells all her farm goods herself at the end of the week at the city wholesale market.

Susanna asks for a loan since she needs to buy animal fodder and hay for her cattle. No one but Kiva lenders can help her in this case and she waits and hopes for support from them.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and hay for her cattle

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with two children, one in school and one too young for school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nzalambi sells goats to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 54-year-old married woman. She is mother of eight children; three of them go to school. Three years ago, she started her own business selling bed sheets when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her business. She buys a variety of bed sheets in bulk from the market at lower rates and sells them in her community. By this time she has attained a good number of customers; most of her clients are her neighbors. 

Mussarat has gradually improved her business. Now she requests a loan of 45,000 PKR. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is married with three children. His wife actively helps him with his business. Rashid has been an IDP (internally displaced person) from his native area over 21 years, and now he lives with his lovely family in Baku region. His children go to secondary school. 

Rashid is a farmer. He has a greenhouse where he grows fresh vegetables. Previously, he has taken out two loans through Kiva, which he has repaid on time. Now he is asking for a loan of 1,550 AZN to repair the water system of his greenhouse. Rashid says thank you to Kiva for all of its support in improving his business.

loans.use: to repair the water system in his greenhouse

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 50 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sokourani, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de jarre, de fruits et légume, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente YIRIDJE la deuxième personne à partir de gauche le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter 25 kg de sucre, 1 paquet de thé, et 1 carton de Lipton chez les grossistes à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
The group Djiguisseme consists of married women. They are on average 50 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sokourani, Marka-coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell cereals, condiments, soap, jars, fruits and vegetables, and a variety of items. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their fourth group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Yiridje, the second person from the left in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently sells a variety of items. She plans to buy 25 kg of sugar, 1 package of tea, and 1 carton of Lipton at the wholesalers in Marka-Coungo. She sells retail and for cash from home to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in the breeding of goats.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sokourani, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de pain, et de potasse. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAH la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pain. Elle compte acheter 50 miches de pains chez les boulanger à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo consists of married women. They are on average 44 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sokourani, Marka-coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell cereals, bread and potash. The women of the Djekafo group are on their fourth group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Mah, the second person from the left, is illiterate. She currently sells bread. She plans to buy 50 loaves of bread from the baker in Marka-coungo. She sells retail and for cash from home to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria esta por cumplir uno de sus mayores sueños, concluir su vivienda, con el apoyo de su esposo que siempre esta ayudandole y apoyandola en todo, solicita el credito para la compra de Ceramica, cemento, Bondex, y un inodoro, ella se siente feliz y agradecida por la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado con este credito.
texts.en: Maria is about to accomplish one of her greatest dreams: the completion of her home with the assistance of her husband who is always helping her and supporting her with everything. She is seeking this loan to purchase ceramic tiles, cement, Bondex and a toilet. She is happy and thankful for the confidence that Kiva and Afodenic have brought her with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates the support of her previous loan. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beans, maize flour, rice and wheat flour to cook food to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beans, maize flour, rice and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 38-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business, transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a favorable location, and his primary customers are locals. He will use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy another motorcycle for his business. His business goal is to buy more motorcycles for his business within 5 years. This is his third loan loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
Kadriye is married and the mother of a boy and a girl. Her children are studying in high school and college. After she retired, she began working with natural stones as a hobby and now makes jewelry with natural stones as well as felt bags and telephone holders. She has done this work for four years. At first, she sold to her friends and acquaintances. Now she sells from her home and sometimes from stands. She will buy goods with this loan.  Her earnings help pay her children's tuition. Because she makes good use of her time, she is content. She believes natural stones bring positive energy to herself and her social circle.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Kadriye , evli bir kız bir erkek çocuk annesi.  Çocukları lise ve üniversitede okuyor.  Emekli olduktan sonra hobi olarak başladığı doğal taşlarla olan uğraşını meslek haline getirmiş.   Doğaltaşlardan takı tasarım keçe işinden çanta ve telefonluk yapıyor.   İşini dört yıldır yapıyor. Önceleri arkadaşlarına ve çevresine satışla başmış .  Satışlarını evden ve zaman zaman da stantlarda yapıyor. Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Çocuklarının okul masraflarına  katkı sağlıyor.  Zamanını iyi değerlendirdiği için manen huzurlu oluyor.  Doğal taşların kendisine ve çevresine pozitif enerji sağladığına inanıyor.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling dressmaking supplies. She offers various colorful laces, buttons and ribbons to the people of her community and earns enough to lead a decent life. She has gained four years of experience in this field and has attained a regular list of customers. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy more threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs. With this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jaime Danilo

texts.es: Jaime de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de enderezado y pintura en su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años, posee mucha clientela por a calidad de su trabajo y los precios accesibles, es un hombre responsable, trabajador y honesto siempre esta pendiente de su hogar, por esa razón ha decidido en solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de pinturas, aceite, pasta, masillas, herramientas, etc. para poder continuar con sus siembras
texts.en:
Jaime is 46 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion. He has been operating a paint and body shop out of his home for several years. Jaime has many customers due to the quality of his work and the affordable prices he charges. He is an honest, responsible, and hardworking man who is always looking after his household.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. The money will be used to buy paints, oil, plastic, putty, tools, and other items so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy paints, oil, plastic, putty, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for maintenance of his passion fruit crops.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business where he sells construction materials, i.e., pipes, taps, cables, cement etc. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy stocks of construction materials for resale. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children. This is his third loan loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of construction materials for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates the previous loan, but she faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. 

With the  requested loan she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for resale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is now requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Fatmira

texts.en: Fatmira built a stable previously with your financial help. Now she needs your kindness to buy a milk cow. Here is what Fatmira said: "I can't believe that there are such kind people in the world that, without even knowing you, they help you financially, and what's most important, they want your very best."

loans.use: to add one more cow; she's got one already

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 36-year-old married women. She is doing a business selling fruits (nuts). She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of five children. She is responsible for their food, health and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase a greater quantity and variety of dried fruits (nuts) such as peanuts, pistachios, and almonds. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of peanuts, pistachios, and almonds.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: leonor de 44 años de edad trabaja como costurera, ella se encarga de confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad de muchos clientes amigos y vecinos. Leonor elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas de vestir para vender en su casa de habitación, con lo que puede obtener ganancias extras. Leonor solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa con lo que pueda realizar más trabajos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leonor, age 44, works as a seamstress.  She makes formal clothing, uniforms, and casual clothes.  She is a very detail-oriented person who does very good work.  This allows her to have many loyal customers, friends and neighbors.

Leonor makes clothes by order.  She also makes garments to sell at her house.  By doing so she is able to get extra income.

Leonor is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy fabric in different colors and patterns.  She will also buy thread, needles, and everything needed to make clothes.  With this she will be able to make more clothes.  This way she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other needed supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a divorced woman with two children who are both in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over 16 years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Dolphina

texts.en:
Dolphina operates a fruit and vegetable business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition, The previous loan helped her to boost her business. 

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She asks for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergent, maize flour, and sugar to sell. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergent, maize flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Turkan

texts.en:
Türkan is married with two grown children and grandchildren. She was a homemaker for many years and raised her children, who learned professions. She then began making dishes, such as manti (Turkish ravioli), pasta and preserved yogurt soups that she made at home for years, as a career. She started filling orders for her friends and acquaintances. She does her work at home and sometimes from stands. She will buy goods with this loan. She is pleased to contribute to the family income, even if it's only a little.

======================================

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Türkan , evli yetişkin iki çocuk annesi, torunları var.  Uzun yıllar ev kadını olarak yaşamış çocuklarını yetiştirmiş ve meslek sahibi olmuşlar.  Evinde yaptığı mantı makarna tarhanayı yıllar sonra meslek haline getirmiş.  Eşe dosta arkadaşlara sipariş alarak başlamış.   İşini evden ve zaman zamanda stantlarda yapıyor.  Maddi olarak ailesine küçük de olsa katkı sağlıyor. Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak. Buda kendisine huzur veriyor.

loans.use: to buy goods for her food production business.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en: Mrike used your money through the previous loan to build a stable. She is very grateful to all of you. She now wants to add a new roof to their family home.

loans.use: to cover the family home with a roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence around his vineyard.

loans.name: Alejandro Macedonio

texts.en:
Alejandro is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Alejandro is 53 years old. He is married and together with his wife he works selling footwear, each from their own location. Only one of his children depends on them, while the rest are now independent. They live in their own home and they consider themselves to be a family where everyone supports each other a lot. His children pay for certain expenses.

He has spent more than 20 years selling footwear and thanks to his business he ahas been able to get his family ahead and to have his own home. Alejandro is seeking this loan to better support his business and to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase tennis shoes and sandals for his store.

loans.name: Abednego

texts.en:
Abednego is a 38-year-old married man with 2 children. 

He describes himself as successful. He operates a clothing retail business. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are local customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad debts. He will use  50,000 KES to restock clothes to sell. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to restock clothes for this retail business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates Kiva lenders for her previous loan that improved her charcoal selling business and enabled her to earn a profit.  She used the profits to improve her living standards.

She requests a loan to pay her children's school fees.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret operates a vegetable stall where she sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 



With this loan she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is thankful for the help of the previous loans. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan to buy various types of paint for resale as the demand is going higher.

loans.use: to buy various types of paint for resale

loans.name: Koxhe

texts.en: Koxhe added a dairy cow with a calf with the loan he received previously from lenders. Unfortunately, the grown calf,that he had planned to sell to cover the costs of his daughter's wedding expenses,died. Kindly note that in northern Albania, where Koxhe is from, it is traditional to throw wedding no matter what. Koxhe now wants this loan to pay those expenses and he will very much appreciate your kind gesture.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's wedding expenses

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zainab operates a food making business making comestibles like beans and chapatis (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, beans and utensils. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and to establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, beans and utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora already knows that if any hardship strikes or a new idea needs financial support that nobody can help and support her as fast as Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon. Her first deal with Kiva helped her to buy calves and fodder for her animals. This time she has new plans. In her farm she is busy with her farm animals, beehives and a fruit-vegetable garden. Flora is very hard working woman and there is not any difficulty that she would not manage to overcome. She continues the sale of a great variety of her farm/dairy products (milk, cheese, butter and the fruits and vegetables from her land). 
This time she hopes that her second deal with Kiva will be as profitable as the first one. This time she will use the loan to purchase of potato cucumber seedlings and she also wants to buy fodder for all her farm animals.

loans.use: purchase of potato and cucumber seedlings and she also wants to buy fodder for all her  farm animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Dielle

texts.en:
Dielle, whose name means 'sun' in Albanian, was able to purchase inventory for the bar-cafe with a previous loan.   She says that she couldn't have done it without your help. 

She now wants to make basic repairs to her family home and requests 100,000 ALL.

loans.use: to repair her family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover for his father's death who sadly passed away ten days ago.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman who has sold crockery for many years with her husband (also shown in the photo). 

She sells various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, and bowls. Her husband assists her in selling them to the people of their community and local market. She makes sufficient income to support the family's needs. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR.  She will use the money to purchase tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. 

She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Naxullu village in the Füzuli region but they have been Internally Displaced Persons from their native land, Füzuli city, for over 21 years.

Shola has been in the animal breeding business. She prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.) from milk and sells them at a local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money.

Today she needs a loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN. With it, Shola wants to vaccinate cows and buy hay so her monthly income will be increased and she can give her children a good education in the future. She greatly thanks the Kiva organization for its help.

loans.use: to vaccinate cows and buy hay

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre quien está bajo su responsabilidad. Carlos posee una pequeña tienda en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, frijoles, bebidas, pan dulce, golosinas etc. Carlos solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo del corredor de la vivienda y asegurar las ventanas para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y 2 ventanas. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así proceder a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Carlos is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his mother who is under his responsibility. Carlos has a small store in which he sells a variety of basic necessity products like: sugar, beans, beverages, sweet bread, candy, etc. Carlos is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he wishes to repair the roof of the hallway of his home and to secure the windows, for which he needs to buy materials like: galvanized steel sheets, wood, and two windows. He hopes to be able to have this financing and continue with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel sheets, wood, and 2 windows to repair the roof of the hallway of his home and give better security.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak is 33 years old and she lives in Dilijan city. Arusyak now lives with her mother; her brother and father live in the Russian Federation working abroad.

Arusyak now works in the Tavush region court as a secretary and her mother works as a saleswoman at a shop. Arusyak is very happy and already impatient since lately her fiancé proposed and now she is going to get married. Her father and brother also help her financially to get prepared for the wedding nicely and properly, but Arusyak still needs some money.

She asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy all the needed products for the wedding party and she also wants to buy a very nice present for her future husband.

loans.use: to buy all the needed products for her wedding party and a wedding present for her future husband

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva lenders. Her previous loan was used to improve her business and living standards.

She requests 40,000 KES to pay her children's school fees.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three children, two in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For over six years, she has operated a tailoring business making garments for both men and women, and also curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with children that attend school. They live in their own home without electricity and running water. 

She has sold fresh water, for the past two years, from home to her neighbors. She faces major weather challenges, especially during the rainy season when business is low. 

She wants to use the loan to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business. Purity dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past three years, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as being her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates for her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is requesting another loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha appreciates the support of the loan and she is doing well with the business. Here again she comes to you asking for another loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and tea leaves for her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and tea leaves for her business.

loans.name: Yesu Tease Group

texts.en:
The group Yesu Tease is composed of seven women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in Dansoman-Accra. The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in second hand clothing, cold store, food stuff, slippers, jewelry and ladies tops.

The women of the group Yesu Tease are on their first loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the micro finance institution ID-Ghana. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, Vivian, is the second person sanding at the left. She is currently selling slippers. She intends to purchase slippers from the market and sell them to customers. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Accra. She plans on making good profit from this loan that will be used to cover the family's day-to-day expenses and she plans to save part.

loans.use: To purchase slippers from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid twenties, is married and has a daughter who is in school. For three years now, she has had a motorbike business for transportation. She employs teenagers who ride these motorbikes. Rehema also manages a motorbike spare parts shop. She opens her shop from 6 am to 7 pm every working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open her spare parts shop and restock spare parts for her shop. Rehema has paid back successfully all of her previous loans. 

She made extra income, which she used to pay for school fees and food for her family. Rehema, in the coming years, would like to build a house. 

She will use this loan to buy new motorbike spares to resell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Nadia, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new motorbike spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 to 8 years. She describes herself to be optimistic.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation in prices.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a continuous cash flow and a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma and her large family live in Ijevan city in the Tavush region.

She has a vocational education and is an accountant.  She has not worked as an account but instead, is a farmer. 

Her current farm has two pigs, five piglets and twenty chickens. Her husband, children and daughter-in-law help her take care of the farm. She has a very rich and colorful fruit garden.  They sell the harvest at the local wholesale market.  She grows potato and cabbage and uses damaged or non-edible produce for fodder for her pigs.  

She says that being seriously engaged in farming and working hard night and day provides a decent income.  Farming has allowed Jemma  to build a nice house for her elder son.

Jemma asks for 700,000 AMD to buy several bulls and fodder for her piglets.  This will help her to expand her farm and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and fodder for her piglets.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Chiola dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, d’habillement et d’ustensile. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  8éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Seli Madou     (2 ème femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette dans le village de Chiola et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de grains de mil qui servira à faire des galettes pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Seli Madou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Danaya all live in polygamous families, and they average 36 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Chiola, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving grains, clothing, and utensils.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth solidarity loan cycle.  

Ms. Seli Madou (second woman sitting from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes in and around the village of Chiola. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large amount of millet, which will be used to make galettes in order to meet the demands of her customers. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Seli Madou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used for the various needs of her children and for increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make galettes

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
This nice and bright lady named Naira is 34 years old and she lives in Dilijan city.

Naira has graduated from Dilijan city's music college, but for many years she did not work in her specialty despite wanting to very much. For several years she was in a juice wholesale trading business, but fortunately she received a chance to work at the local school as a teacher of singing. Naira’s husband works at a private construction company and their two sons are school-aged.

Naira asks for a loan since she has an idea of establishing a small trading business again as she has free time and she may use it for earning much money for her family. The loan amount she will use for the purchase of some space where she can start her business.

loans.use: to purchase some space where she can start her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is asking for her second loan from Kiva, since her first loan turned to be a very profitable and successful one. 

She is still running her food trading business from her home. Now she has more customers and new ideas to enlarge her business. Anahit has three children and despite that all of them are married, they all greatly help their mother in her business. Anahit sells a great range of household supplies, candies, vegetables, and fruits, and all these she buys from providers. Her customers are very satisfied both with the prices and food assortment of Anahit’s shop. Anahit lives in Yerevan and her shop is located in a very convenient place for trading and is close to the central road.

Anahit asks for a loan of 3,000 US dollars since she wants to make her food shop assortment bigger; she wants to buy greens apple, pears, and some new candies so that she can renew her shop assortment and have better trade.

loans.use: to make her food shop assortment bigger and have better trade

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 49 years old and he lives in the village of Khdranc in Syunik region. Andranik is married and he has two sons and a daughter. His daughter is married and she lives separately with her family, his elder son is doing military service and the smallest one is still school-aged. Andranik used to work as a welder, then as a driver, but now he is fully engaged in farming and agriculture with his wife. He has a rich farm with 5 cows, 25 sheep and 20 chickens. He also has a greenhouse he built on his own, where he cultivates greens and onions. On his plot of land he raises a great range of fruit trees and vegetables such as beans, cucumber and potatoes. All his farm products he sells right from his house to his customers or to re-sellers.

Andarnik is asking for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy new sort of potato seedlings and he also wants to buy several piglets and make his farm richer with farm animals.

loans.use: to buy new sorts of potato seedlings, several piglets and make his farm richer with farm animals.

loans.name: Mwanafatime

texts.en:
Mwanafatime is married. She has children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a business selling fresh water for the past years, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality – especially during rainy season, the business is low.

With this loan, she wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
This is Nakali. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to add more stock to her restaurant business.  

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Eddith

texts.en:
Eddith is a divorced woman with three children, two of whom are adults and one is in school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuffs for her food stall

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a farmer who lives in the Nyamira area of the Nyanza side of Kenya. This area grows a lot of bananas.  She loves to  farm and grow crops.  This has been her business for 7 years.

Her primary source of income is selling milk and bananas.  She also has a retail business.

Her biggest challenge is harvesting tea because there are not enough laborers.

Peninah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loan requirements are client friendly.  During the training, she learned proper loan repayment.  She said that this loan will enable her to purchase a water tank and get direct access to water for her crops and livestock.  The farm will become more productive.  

This loan will enable Peninah to earn more income and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 31-year-old married woman. She has one child who is two years old. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to recharge her vaults of electronic money for transfer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase nutrients and fertilizer, among other items to support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a very hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is a divorced woman with two school-going children.

Binti has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. 

She needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu, to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa money transfer business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy greens, tomatoes, lettuce and other vegetables.

loans.name: Akhtar  Parveen

texts.en: Akhtar Parveen, age 34, is a married woman. She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. At present, she has 3 goats, 2 cows and 3 buffaloes. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 31-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has 2 buffaloes for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is the mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with Kashf's support. Now she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Batool

texts.en: At the age of 47, Batool is the mother of four children. She has been running a business manufacturing wooden handles which are used for various purposes. She earns sufficient income to cover their household expenditures through her business. By this time she has attained a good number of customers. Currently, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase good quality wood, cutters and nails in large quantity. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, cutters and nails in large quantity.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 39, is a married woman and the mother of two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a business selling eggs on his motorcycle to the people of their community. He earns good amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of his business, Nasreen applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help him to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity to inflate his sales. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a great assortment of candies and sausages, which are in great demand by her customers

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.en:
Eutropia, who is in her early forties, is single with two children--one son and one daughter--both of whom are at school. She has been running a food shop for five years now. She works from 06.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Eutropia's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy new items for her shop. She dreams of improving her business.

Eutropia will share this loan with her loan group "Paris" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new items for her shop.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija does a business of weaving. Here again, she comes to you asking for a loan to buy 6 bundles of weaving materials for the business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy 6 bundles of weaving materials.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase biscuits, sweets, chewing gum, onions, and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sweets, chewing gum, onions, groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is 44 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his van. He has been driving a van for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Musarat has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She makes Gol Gappay, a popular street food dish in Pakistan. It consists of a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water, chili, potato, and chickpeas. She is expert in making it and is earning enough to lead a decent life with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Sakeena’s husband. Her husband assists her in selling door-to-door and in a local market. They serve well in their community. Currently, Sakeena requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of ingredients such as stock of chickpeas, spices, baking soda and graham flour in a large quantity to increase their sales. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients such as stock of chickpeas, spices, baking soda and graham flour.

loans.name: Drane

texts.en:
Drane wants to build an animal stable. You can see in the background the existing primitive stable. “It is very cold in our village as you know and my animals sleep and stay in a cold and very tiny space. I think often of the suffering that my animals go through. I don’t want them to go any longer like this. I would very, very much appreciate any help from lenders; financial help through lending me the amount I need to build the stable,” said Drane during her interview.
 
Drane is from the northern Albania and the way she is dressed is very traditional in her region. Women there wear pants always underneath the skirt or dress and they cover their braided hair all the time and everywhere.

Drane’s activity has been the livestock for very long time. She has cows and chickens and she sells raw milk and grass fed organic eggs.

loans.use: to build a stable.

loans.name: Peace-Shallon Group

texts.en:
The members of the group Peace-Shallon are two women, who average 41 years of age and have two children each. They live in traditional families in the Teshie community (Ghana). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in cooking and washing utensils and cosmetics.

Portia, the featured borrower, sells cosmetics. She intends to purchase cosmetics from the market in Accra and sell to customers. She plans to make a good profit from this loan and it will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics from the market in Accra and sell to customers.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 30-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be honest and committed. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes for resale. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, the business will yield more returns which will enable her pay school fees for her child. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back to the business and repay her loan.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is is a divorced woman with five children, two in school and three adults. She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwaka has operated a cafe business making constables like, rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for the business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for the business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with no children. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a suitable location, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of drinks to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will own a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married mother of two children, one in school and one underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Joan has operated a cereals shop at the market for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and delayed payments by debtors as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams and ground nuts. Her dream is to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams and ground nuts.

loans.name: Damali

texts.en:
Damali appreciates the contribution of Kiva lenders towards her previous loan.

She works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day.  She started her business to get money for school fees and earn a living. She is acquiring this loan to boost her business by restocking all the goods desired by her customers.  Her clients are local people from the villages around her residence.

Her future hope is to expand her business.  The challenges she faces are the seasonal goods, price fluctuation and lack of enough capital. She is a honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders to reduce interest rates further.

loans.use: to buy more dry agricultural produce

loans.name: Demirhan

texts.en:
Demirhan who is been photographed with her little grandchild, wants to buy a milk cow and the loan she is requesting will help her achieve this goal.

Agriculture/livestock is something that she has being practicing for very long time now; she plants corn, beans and potatoes in quantity. In addition to this she has a cow. Demirhan sells raw milk and other agro-products to some nearby farmers' markets. 

The region and more preciously the commune where Demirhan lives, is known for the quantity and quality of its potato produce. The traditional food here is some homemade pebble-size pasta called ‘trahana’ in Albanian and Greek. This is made with sour milk, eggs and flour and requires drying for days; it is used in soups and stews, for breakfast and even is used as a dessert. Our grandmothers used to do this on weekends, and they occupied the whole house for this activity; they then spread linens on every corner of the house to put the ‘trahana’ to dry. As kids we loved this funny and messy activity. :)

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of four, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. She resides in a home where the family has access to electricity and piped water. She has a business selling used clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for six years. She works at the market six days per week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. 

Harriet decided to Join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charges.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes and used shoes. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more  bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: Milkah is a 28-year-old married woman.  She has one child who is 4-years-old. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells scrap metal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of scrap metal for sell. Her business goal is to operate a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of scrap metal for sell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Salamatu from the Goderich Western urban area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 1990, Salamatu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well making more profits.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to the higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
Justice is a group that is composed of six members. They are from Dansoman and work as individuals. They are hardworking, enterprising members who do not give up easily. Currently, they are requesting a total loan of 5,500 cedis (GHS) from ID Ghana in order to increase their business levels. They are into the sale of fish, foodstuffs, slippers, cooking oil, and medicine.

Mavis is the featured borrower and leader of the group. She is 42 years old and a married woman with two children. She has been selling foodstuffs to customers for 18 years which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. Her business has helped her to provide for her family.

Mavis is turning to ID Ghana to request a loan of 1,000 GHS because her customers have orders for cassava, plantain and vegetables for the festivity ahead, and she would like to be able to fulfill them for her customers. This will increase her profit and offer a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy and sell cassava, plantain and vegetables.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 27 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as motivated and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish for resale. Her business goal is to own a big business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Fudia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Fudia, she is a 20-year-old from the Goderich Western urban area in Freetown. She is married with two children. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and improve her standard of living.  

Fudia runs a retail business, she sells palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days a week. Fudia says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her area of operation.

Fudia has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in her own house which has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

Fridah has operated a cosmetic business for the past two years. Her potential customers are women. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals and air conditioners for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewellery, chemicals and air conditioners for resale

loans.name: Napoleón Ovidio

texts.es:
Napoleón tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Napoleón se desempeña como  oficial de bus de la Universidad de Bolívar. Solicita el crédito para seguir estudiando y para compra de útiles. Los estudios los realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es ser profesional. Sus desafíos cumplir con los estudios. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Rumi Loma Community, within the Guaranda settlement of the Bolivar province.

He is a member of the Reyna del Cisne group, located in Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the Guaranda office.  It’s made up of 10 members who are all farmers.

Napoleón works as a bus official at Universidad de Bolívar and is asking for this loan so he can continue studying and to buy school supplies.  He studies in Guaranda and is goal is to become a professional.  His challenge is to complete his studies and he likes to play sports in his spare time.  Carnival is his favorite tradition.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the roofing of their family home

loans.name: Henerietta

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Henerietta, from Goderich (western urban area) in Freetown. She is married with five children. 13 years ago, Henerietta established her clothing material business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 5:30 PM, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price control and customer attitudes during sales.

Henerietta requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her clothing stock. In the future, Henerietta plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton material for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 59-year-old woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 20 to 30 years. She describes herself as humble and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with a ready market. She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle for transporting milk for sale. Her business goal is to be a leading supplier in the area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will employ more people. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more motorcycles for transport.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transporting milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, salt, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile, a married mother of three, is applying for this loan to pay for her son’s weeding expenses. Weddings in the northern region where she comes from are traditionally the parents’ obligation for those who reside there.

Dile’s activity is agriculture; she mainly plants & harvests wheat. She produces wheat not just for homemade bread for the entire year, but she also sells it in small quantities. Dile’s husband’s profession is welding; he also works for fellow villagers for cash, by manually clearing thorns and preparing the soil for plantation. The most common orchards in their village are persimmons, oranges, olives and grapevines.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale

loans.name: Zoila Yesenia

texts.es: Zoila de 37 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Zoila vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. Zoila  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, tomates, papas, cebollas,  etc. por mayor ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 37, is a very hardworking person who is fully committed to her business, doing everything with the sole desire to move forward, and in this way, provide a better life for her family. Zoila lives with her husband and their four children in her own house. 

She has had a fruit and vegetable stand in the market near her place of residence for 15 years. Her husband helps her with the business.
