Zoila is requesting a loan so that she can purchase papayas, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, etc. wholesale, as this way, she will be able to sell more. This is her priority, as it is the way that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase papayas, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive e casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como taxista. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Maria es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a ITNEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
María, 34, lives in her own house with her husband, who works as a taxi driver.  She has had a tortilla business in her home for many years and has acquired a lot of customers because of her excellent service.  She's very friendly with all the people who visit her and always has a smile on her face for them.

María's dedicated to her job and is very talented at making tortillas and serving her customers quickly.  Her biggest struggles in life are the ones she faces every day so she can realize her dreams.

María's ready to work hard for her goal, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy corn wholesale to keep on being productive.

She hopes to give her family economic security at home.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: El grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” está conformado por socios que se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Derly  tiene 31 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos educando. Ella implemento su librería hace 02 años en su vivienda. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cuadernos colores fólderes lápices plumones  por campaña escolar. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su librería con la venta de juguetes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Derly es la primera persona parada del lado izquierdo viste polo negro. Y de la misma  manera se encuentra adherida la foto del señor Pedro en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The “Entrepreneurs of Huerta House” group is composed of members who are dedicated to diverse activities in retail commerce.

Derly is 31 years old, single, and has 2 children she is educating. Some 2 years ago, she began a book shop in her house. In previous years she was dedicated to her home. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing colored notebooks, folder, pencils and pens for students. Derly's greatest desire is to expand her book shop with the sale of toys.

The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the offered loan. 

Derly is the 1st person on the left and is dressed in a black t-shirt. At the same time, you will notice Pedro, attached to the photo in the upper left. He could not be present at the meeting due to work requirements.

loans.use: buy colored notebooks, folders, pencils, and pens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa del suegro. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; la clienta es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. ella tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old and lives with her husband in her father-in-law's house. She has a shop where she sells staple goods such as rice, beans, milk and more. Lately the borrower has gained many new customers as she always has what people need. She offers products of excellent quality at affordable prices and with unbeatable service. This borrower is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead. She wants to feel like a winner. The secrets to her success are her consistency and dedication. This borrower wants to expand her business and so is applying for a loan from "Integral". This will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and more. The borrower has confidence that, with dedication, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, rice, soap and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Alba Jeannette

texts.es: Alba tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad. Alba es una mujer increíble quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Alba desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su hogar por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura dado que desea pintar las paredes de la vivienda ya que la pintura que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. Además, también desea comprar vidrios para repara las ventanas solaires que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado y no dan mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Alba, 44, is the single mother of two children, ages 7 and 13.  She's an incredible woman who does everything in her power to give her children what they need.

Alba wants to improve her home, so she has asked FUSAI for a loan.  She's going to invest in buying paint to paint the walls of her house, which are in poor condition.  She also wants to buy pieces of glass to repair the windows, which are in bad condition and don't provide a lot of security.

loans.use: to buy paint and pieces of glass

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINDIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Solomanibougou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, sel, de médicaments traditionnels, de beurre de karité, de farine de blé, de galette, du lait, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe SINDIYA sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MARIAM ZOUMANA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de farine de blé. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de farine boulangère, et du sachet plastique chez les grossistes à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Sindiya consists of married women. They are on average 32 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Solomanibougou, Marka-coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell condiments, salt, traditional medicine, shea butter, wheat flour, pancakes, milk, and a variety of items. The women of the Sindiya group are on their seventh group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Mariam Zoumana, the second person from the left in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently sells wheat flour. She plans to buy 1 bag of baker's flour and plastic bags from the wholesalers in Marka-coungo. She sells retail and for cash from home to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be used to ensure the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, rice, and cooking seasoning for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 44 years old and married with three children who are in school. Nelyn works very hard to provide for them. Nelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Liza has been in this business for five years now.


She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell.


In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Geramie

texts.en:
Geramie is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell.

Geramie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items such as fish, meat, rice, beans, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale plantains

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling herbal medicine in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Para ella lo más importante es su hijo y es por quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar mejores condiciones de vida. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, and she lives in her own home with her son.  She is a very hardworking woman who has been providing housekeeping services for a long time.  For her, the most important thing is her son, and she does everything in her power to provide him with better living conditions. 

María is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in repairs for the roof of her home, as it is deteriorated. With the requested amount, she will purchase galvanized sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting and wood, in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy talcum powder, body lotion, and hand lotion

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with three children; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (brothers). She has a business of selling charcoal, tomatoes, and onions. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of tomatoes as well as more bags of charcoal and onions. She has been in this business for four years, sells on a retail basis only, and works from home. She generates additional income from selling piped water. Her monthly expenses include transportation and perished goods. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler as well as to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions, and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 17 años, 15 años, 12 años y 10 años de edad. Desde hace más de 5 años María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en la principales zonas de su localidad. María desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda y encementar el piso de la misma. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para repellara las paredes de la vivienda así como para encementar el piso de la misma.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives in her own house with her husband and her four children, ages 17, 15, 12, and 10.  She has sold beauty products via catalogue for more than five years.  She works as a street vendor in the main areas of her town.

María wants to plaster the walls and cement the floor of her house, so she's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Morena De Los Angeles

texts.es: Morena tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad. Hace algunos años su esposo se vio obligado a viajar al Extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida dado que dentro de su localidad no lograba cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Morena se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace más de 12 años. También mantiene la venta de refrescos y golosinas dado que con lo que percibe en concepto de remesas de su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Morena solicita este crédito a FUSAI ya que desea construir un baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Confía que con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio logrará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Morena, 46, lives in her own house with her two children, ages 6 and 14.  A few years ago her husband had to go abroad in search of better living conditions because he wasn't able to cover his family's needs in his community.

Morena has earned a living for more than 12 years selling beauty products via catalogue.  She also sells beverages and snacks, because her husband's remittances aren't enough to cover the household necessities.

Morena's asking FUSAI for this loan because she she needs bricks, cement, sand, and rebar to build a bathroom.

She trusts that with her business income she'll be able to pay back the debt from the loan.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and rebar to build a bathroom

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 60 years old. She is a widow with three children. 

Vilma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Vilma has been running a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosario

texts.es: Francisca tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su padre de 90 años de edad quien está bajo su responsabilidad. Francisca se dedica a la venta de tortillas y es así como genera ingresos para subsistir y mantener la economía de su hogar junto a su compañero de vida quien es agricultor. Francisca solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un tapial y para encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Francisca, 60, lives in her own house with her companion and her 90-year-old father, who's in her care.  She makes a living selling tortillas, which is how she earns the income to survive and support the family budget along with her husband, a farmer.

Francisca's requesting this loan from FUSAI to build a wall and cement the porch of her house.  With the requested amount she'll buy cement, sand, bricks, and gravel.

She hopes to be able to have this support so she can begin making the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and gravel

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 38 years old. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. Charito works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past 18 years, Charito has been running a retail charcoal business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Charito would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Karla Lorena

texts.es: Karla tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 11 años, 8 años y 3 años de edad. Karla se dedica a la venta de frutas, cosméticos y lociones. La venta la realiza desde hace 7 años y gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Karla desea construir un pequeño cuarto y cercar el terreno con postes de cemento para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de postes de cemento, lámina galvanizada, y madera para cercar el terreno y para construir un pequeño cuarto.
texts.en:
Karla, 38, lives in her own house with her three children, ages 11, 8, and 3.

Karla makes a living selling fruit, cosmetics, and lotion.  She has had her business for seven years.  Thanks to her charisma, she has been able to earn the trust of a lot of customers who prefer her more every day.

Karla wants to build a small room and fence her property with cement posts.  She's requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement posts, galvanized metal sheets, and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement posts, galvanized metal sheets, and wood

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling bananas. 

Elsie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. Elsie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is 46 years old and married with four children.  With one children in school, Ma. Lyn works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Lyn has been in this business for 18 years. 

In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 62 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. Nida works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is a 43-year-old, married man with two children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

He has a business that buys and sells coconuts in the Philippines. Melecio requested a 24,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell.

Melecio has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Melecio would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana works hard to support her family. Rosana is married and has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of firewood to sell.

Rosana has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 61 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita works hard to support her family. Tita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, etc.

Tita has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Tita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, etc

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a 22,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase gasoline, bamboo, and fishing nets for her fishing business.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, bamboo, and fishing nets for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sauda works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from vending cultured pearls. 

Sauda is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Sauda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is married and works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Jinna has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

In the future, Jinna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married, has a fishing business in the Philippines, and works hard to support her family.

She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 39 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, oil, magic seasoning, groceries, etc. to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Jonalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, oil, magic seasoning, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kryztle

texts.en:
Kryztle is 23 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Kryztle has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Kryztle aspires to save money to expand her business and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seasonal produce such as tamarind, papaya, watermelon, sweet oranges, jocote (a tropical fruit), etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and married with 13 children, four of whom are in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 38 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Emilda has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Emilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 28 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Jennylyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol Naciente” está conformada por 06 socios responsables y emprendedores. María de 29 años es separada y  tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como el cebiche, se viene desempeñando hace más de 2 año donde le va bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarle  educación a sus hijos. El deseo de María es de seguir implementando su negocio y llegar a capturar más  clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de pescado, papa, camote y limones. El grupo “Sol Naciente” agradece  por hacer posible este crédito. María lleva consigo en su espalda a su bebe, es la segunda del lado posterior derecho.
texts.en:
Sol Naciente Group is made up of six responsible and enterprising members.

María, 29, is separated and has three dependent children.  She earns a living selling food such as ceviche.  She has been doing this work for more than two years and it's going well for her.  Thanks to her effort she can give her children an education.

María wants to continue with her business and attract more customers, so she requested a loan to buy fish, potatoes, sweet potatoes, and lime.

Sol Naciente Group is grateful for making this loan possible.  María's the second one from the right in the back; she's carrying her baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy fish, potatoes, sweet potatoes, and limes

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 54 years old and married with three children who are all studying. She lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga.  She has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She joined Paglaum in 2009 and has been enjoying the benefits of being a member in good standing. Adeline is requesting a loan for payment of pawned cocoland. Adeline wants to use the land as an additional source of income. The profit she earns from the cocoland supports the tuition fees for her three children.

loans.use: to pay for pawned cocoland

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is 56 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is married with five adult-aged children. She has been engaged in fish selling for seven years with a monthly income of PHP 10,000 doing this kind of work.  She joined Paglaum seven years ago and applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock of fish to sell.  The profit she earns from her business is used to save for retirement and for the daily consumption of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 41 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is from Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ.  She is engaged in agriculture, which she has been doing for six years.  She earns a monthly income of 2,500 PHP. 

Rosana requested a loan from Paglaum, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her garden.  She will use the profits to pay the school expenses of her children and save for college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Lolita has a business selling fruits in the market. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Lolita has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Lolita would like to put up another profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with eight children. Rosemarie is 58 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines.

Rosemarie is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional piglets and sacks of feed.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Meralona

texts.en: Meralona is 42 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Mis. Occ.  She is married with two school age and one adult age children.  She has been engaged in rug making for four years and joined Paglaum in 2009.  She earns 1,500 PHP per month from this job. She applied in Paglaum for a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase materials for rug making.  The profit she earns in her business is used to support the school expenses of her two students.

loans.use: to purchase materials for rug making

loans.name: Reno

texts.en:
Reno is 30 years old and married with a one-year-old child.  He lives in North Mapang, Rizal. He joined the Paglaum Cooperative last year.  He started driving a motorized tricycle in 2012 as a source of his income. He earned 2,000 PHP monthly with this kind of work.  

Reno applied for a loan to Paglaum worth 4,000 PHP to purchase materials for his tricycle repair. The income from his job will be used to support their daily consumption and savings for the education of his child.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his motorized tricycle repair

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 53 years old and lives in Gata Daku Clarin. He is married with three children. 

Gerardo has a vegetable vending business and sari-sari store earning approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested to purchase stock for his business. He wants to purchase basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and other items. 

Gerardo has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Gerardo hopes to improve his living conditions and to put up other branches.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and lives in Gata Daku Clarin mis Occ . She is married with two school-aged children.
  
Josephine has a cosmetic business earning approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Winsthrow

texts.en: Winsthrow is 64 years old, married with 3 adult age children.  He lives in Dampalan, Dapitan city.  He engaged in sari-sari store for 5 years and joined Paglaum last 2011.  He earns 5,000 PHP per month in the business.  He applied for a loan in Paglaum to restock store with basic commodities.  The profit he earned in his business is used to provide their basic needs and savings for their retirement.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 49 years old and lives in Sulipat, Calamba. She is married with three adult and two school-aged children.  She has been engaged in buying and selling coconuts for three years and joined Paglaum in 2009.  She earns 2,000 PHP per month in this type of job.  She applied to Paglaum to buy more coconut to sell. The profit she earns in this business is used to support the daily expenses of her children who are students and for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is from San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 53 years old and married with five school-age kids.

In 2010, Santas applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Santas asked for financial assistance of PHP 15,000 to pay for land preparation and seedbed preparation for her farm. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her farming business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 57 years old, married and lives in Minlasag, Sibutad with three school-aged children.  She joined Paglaum in 2009 and has been engaged in a sari-sari store for three years.  

Tita earned a monthly income of 3,500 PHP with this kind of business.  She applied for a loan to Paglaum in the amount of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional stock for her business.  She wants to purchase stock of basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and other items. The profit she earns in her business will be used to support the financial expenses of her students and payment of tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase stock of basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and other items

loans.name: Alma Luna

texts.en:
Alma Luna is 28 years old and a resident of San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two school-age kids. She earns a living through raising pigs.

She has been a member of PMPC since February 2014 and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy one piglet and one sack of feed for her growing hog-raising business.

Alma Luna deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy one piglet and one sack of feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old, married and a resident of San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari store. She joined PMPC in February 2014 and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy additional inventories such as canned goods, instant noodles, etc.

Gloria deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories such as canned goods and instant noodles

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 41 years old. She is married and has five children. She is also a good mother and a good wife to her husband. She takes good care of her children and educates them. Marilyn is an active member of Paglaum MPC and has recently sought a loan to buy fertilizer for her garden. Marilyn wants to finish her children so that they can help them and for their future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Trigos, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 56 years old, married with three adult-age children and a resident of San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns a living through vegetable gardening.

She has been a member of PMPC since February 2014 and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy seedlings and two sacks of organic fertilizers.

Anna deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and two sacks of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en: Novelita is widowed with four children. She is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion Mahayag Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Novelita is a farmer and at the same time, a survivor pensioner of her late (PNP) husband. She has been doing this for 10 years with capital from her pension. She has requested a loan to finance her pigs and her farm (10 sacks of feed and 5 sacks of fertilizer). Novelita has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years. In the future, Novelita hopes to earn more for the expansion of her piggery.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DAMBE est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de DIATOU qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, divers articles de boutique avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DAMBE is composed of five married women, who average 39 years of age and four children each. They live in nuclear families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to have better businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, as does DIATOU, who is the first woman sitting at the left in the photo. With this loan, she intends to purchase various shop goods from Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or on credit at the market and at her house. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio tiene 31 años, casado, se  dedica a la actividad de confección de ropa el confecciona chamarras, tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Nueva Tilata,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y el  señor Gregorio va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de tela para incrementar la confección de prendas de vestir y también para un motor para su vehículo ya que esta es su fuente de transporte que le permite llevar sus productos terminados a los distintos mercados donde ofrece su prendas terminadas, el señor Gregorio tiene muchos pedidos de chamarras que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas tiene mucha demanda, el señor Gregorio es una persona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gregorio is 31 years old and married. He makes a living by making jackets. His workshop is located in the area of Nueva Tilata. This is his first loan with the institution and Gregorio is going to use it to buy fabric in order to increase the number of garments he makes. He will also buy a motor for his vehicle, as it is his mode of transport for taking his finished products to the different markets where he sells his finished garments. Gregorio has many orders for jackets that he has to fill, since they are in high demand at this time of year. Gregorio is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead in life and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing and a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase LPG to use for cooking

loans.name: Xatira

texts.en:
Xatira is 36 years old. She is single and is living with her parents. Her mother was sick for long years and needs care. Xatira so loves her mother and takes care of her, and therefore can’t get married. 

The family members are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from Khojaly city, which was occupied by Armenians in February 26,1992. Then they were refugees from their native lands and now are living in the Absheron region. 

Xatira has a small store where she sells daily food products. Today, Xatira wants to increase her business, and for this reason she has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 2,100 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN) to buy more products for sale. 

She is thankful to the Kiva organization and to all lenders for aid. 

In the future Xatira wants to increase the area of her store, and in her personal life wants to get married and have a child.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BEN   est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans la village de de SIDO. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la 3ème femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt plusieurs qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BEN is composed of five married women, who average 42 years of age and seven children each. They live in nuclear families in the village of SIDO. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity, so as to improve their commerce, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in condiments, as does DJENEBA, who is the third woman sitting at the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to purchase several qualities of condiments from Bamako wholesalers. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or on credit at the market and at her house. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sinignessigui vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Chiola dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de charbon et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Setou (1 ère femme arrêtée de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de charbon de bois dans le village de Chiola et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter beaucoup de sacs de charbon  de bois pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Setou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de7 5000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Sinignessigui all live in polygamous families, and they average 41 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Chiola, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving charcoal and grains.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth solidarity loan cycle.  

Ms. Setou (the first woman standing at the left in the photo) is a major vendor of charcoal in and around the village of Chiola. She intends to use her loan to purchase many sacks of charcoal to meet the demand from her customers. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit.

With this loan, Ms. Setou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet the sundry needs of her children and to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 20-year-old married woman. She has one child who is aged one year. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more milk to sell. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Adalet

texts.en:
Adalet is 52 years old and is married with two children. His son is 19 years old and is studying a secondary course at college. His daughter is 17 years old and is in eleventh class at school in preparation for music college. The family is living in the Absheron region but are refugees from occupied territory – Fuzuli city. 

Adalet is a master who makes wooden doors and windows. He now needs a loan amount of 1,550 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy materials which he needs in his work, for example, wood, glass, hinges, etc. He says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for its aid.

loans.use: to buy materials, for example, wood, glass, hinges, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a motorcycle transport business where she has employed someone to transport customers. She has been involved in this business for two years. She also operates a grocery store where she sells groceries. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be security and climate changes. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain the business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. Previously, she was operating a salon business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business and a stock of groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children with ages 12 years and 14 years. He operates a tailoring business in which he makes dresses for selling. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standards of living. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 23-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages of 2 years and 6 years. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and pastries. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy ingredients for making the pastries she sells. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making the pastries she sells

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 16 years. She describes herself to be caring. She operates a retail business where she sells bedcovers and bedsheets. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. 

She will use the 100,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy more stock of bedcovers and bedsheets. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will help her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 150,000 KES were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bedcovers and bedsheets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a transport business where she transports customers using a tuk tuk. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 120,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy stock of groceries to enable her to open a grocery store. This will enable her to earn more income. Her business goal is to own a van within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent home for her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans  were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to enable her open a grocery store

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en:
Bahruz, aged 28, is a taxi driver. He is single and lives in the Absheron region with his parents, but Bahruz’s family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city since his childhood. His parents are old and cannot work. Bahruz has been a taxi driver for three years: he transports people between various areas of the Absheron region. 

A few days ago, his car broke down and he cannot work. For this reason, Bahruz has applied to the Komak company to take out a loan. With this loan, he will repair his taxi. Bahruz needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He hopes that his car will be repaired soon and he can start to work again. Bahruz is thankful to the Kiva organization for its help. In the future, Bahruz wants to get married.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
The Sarah Group consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan for the amount of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Fawziah is the leader of the group. She is still engaged. Although she is only a secondary school graduate, she has managed to find a job with the government. 

Fawziah is an ambitious and educated woman. She wants to improve her skills and learn new things to be able to get a better job. She decided to learn how to use a computer and its different programs. Her salary is very low and barely covers her own daily expenses, so she cannot afford to buy a desktop computer. She has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a desktop computer. She hopes that learning how to use the computer's different programs will help her to find another job and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a desktop computer

loans.name: Themneikim

texts.en:
Themneikim is a lovely, bright, young and ambitious woman. She is pictured with her mother standing on the left side. She is 26 years old from Imphal, Manipur in the northeastern region of India. She has six siblings. Her mother is a housewife and her father runs a chemist store in their locality. The family’s only income generating source is through this store. Themneikim has aspired to become an airline cabin crew member since she was young. As she loves traveling, being paid to travel is one of the job’s biggest perks. It allows one to see the world and make money at the same time. 

Due to her family’s poor economic condition, she could not even consider thinking of enrolling in such a reputable and expensive profession. Therefore, she changed her mind and pursued a less expensive career in nursing after she completed pre secondary education. However, after acquiring her G.N.M (General Nursing Midwifery) degree too, she didn't stop aspiring to pursue her dream career. And as luck would have it, she was selected in a cabin crew interview that was conducted in Imphal. Though she has cleared the interview, her joy was incomplete because she has to pay a security deposit to undergo the training. This is a huge amount of money that is beyond her family’s capacity. 

Since her parents cannot afford to provide such a huge amount, Themneikim sought help from her friends who are also members of Kiva and they told her about Kiva's help for those who need financial support in terms of a loan. She thanks Kiva for helping in times of need and making her dream career come true.  In the future, Themneikim says that she wants to keep her parents free from financial worries, help her siblings get a better education and help the poor and needy people by setting her own private old age home and orphanage.

loans.use: To pay for a refundable deposit for airline cabin crew training

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Om Mohammed Group

texts.en:
Om Mohammed is a group of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a loan for the amount of 160,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Latifa, aged 35, is a married woman and the mother of four children. She is the leader of the group. She lives with her family in a small house in Sana'a. 

Although Latifa only has a preliminary school certificate, she is very ambitious. To help her husband to provide a decent life for their children, Latifa has been working as a door-to-door salesperson for five years. She sells clothes and perfumes to women in her quarter. She has become famous in her neighborhood and her customers are requesting more and more stylish clothes. She is preparing for the marriage season when the demand in new clothes increases, but she does not have enough capital and is in need of money. Therefore, she has applied for a 50,000 YER loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy clothes for resale. Latifa looks forward to selling the best and most stylish clothes in her quarter to attract more customers and increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 57-year-old married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 22 to 39 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing, hardworking and kind. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an area with ready market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to boost the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Lhingjanei

texts.en:
Popular as the girl with 12 siblings, 20-year-old Lhingjanei is also the reigning title holder of the coveted crown for their community and recently she was got selected as a cabin crew member for an airliner in India. She is pictured with her mother in the photo.  

Being born into a huge family with five big brothers and seven older sisters who are supported by a parent who is a cultivator is challenging. It also thrills a lot of villagers, shares Lhingjanei as she laughs. She lives in a village that is about 50 km away from the town of Imphal in Manipur. it is one of the northeastern states in India.

Being the youngest and being pampered, Lhingjanei finds it difficult to leave home, face the world by herself and be independent. She says her eldest sister-in-law has been her inspiration and motivates her for a good cause. Happy with the news of the job selection and sad because she has to leave home and work abroad, the family is vulnerable. Her middle brother, who is working for one of the Kiva partners in India, introduced her to an educational loan because her parents cannot pay the refundable deposit money because the harvesting season has ended and they have no means to sell the produces in a limited time. The introduction of educational loans by Kiva and WSDS is a blessing for one who is determined to support herself without disturbing the family and repay the loan on time with her salary.

With the Kiva loan, she will pay her security deposit to the airline company and join the aviation industry as a cabin crew member.  “I am so happy that, I will be able to pay my security deposit with the help of Kiva,” says Lhingjanei, because this opportunity gives her a chance to prove that she is capable now of taking care of herself. She will work sincerely and will repay the loan on time. 

The Kiva partnership with WSDS has helped a lot of youngsters like her and the continuation of this partnership may also support lots more like her. She says, “Thank you so much Kiva”.

loans.use: To pay for a refundable deposit for airline cabin crew training

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 39-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she offers computer repair services and sells computer accessories and computers. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of computers and computer accessories. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP-DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more computers and computer accessories

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough resources. He will use the KES 85,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to have an electronic supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, the business will grow and will improve his family's living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP-DTM. His previous loan of KES 70,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be strict. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are rural residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems during the rainy season. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her third loan with SMEP-DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man with one child who is nine years old. He describes himself to be business-oriented. He operates a farm where he grows crops to sell. Michael also runs a transport business where he owns motorcycles for transporting customers from one place to another to earn extra income. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area ideal for the business operation and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

Michael will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. His business goal is to create more job opportunities within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 23-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be good at what she does. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her standards of living. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood for her retail business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old married man with three children. He describes himself as focused and determined. Peter operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are the neighboring community. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the increase in licence charges for his business. 

Peter will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more meat to sell. His business goal is to be able to supply meat to hotels and institutions within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best in the business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans of KES 100,000 were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Smail

texts.en: Smail goes by the name of "Pastor Smail." He is the minister of a local church in a small community named "Fond Blanc" about 2 hours from Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti. He is also the principal of a school within the community. In this community there is no access to electricity so the people use "lamp tèt gridap, candles, etc," which are not good for their health. Pastor Smail realizes that the Eneji Pwop products are not only better for the people's health, but also save the people money. So he wants to help his community by selling the Eneji Pwop products (Powapak & Sunking Pro), but he also will improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To buy Powapak and Sunking Pro from Enèji Pwòp to resell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 46-year-old married woman. She describes herself as a person with potential. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. 

Julia will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy materials to construct a larger shop where she can operate her business.This will enable her to stock more goods to sell. Her business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a larger shop where she can operate her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range from three to nine years. She describes herself to be determined and confident. Mercy operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for doing business. 

Mercy will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Rebecca purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Feliciah purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Miniver purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Juan Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Rodrigo es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a fabricar mochilas y maletas para viaje, tiene 37 años y se inicio en este trabajo hace 23 años, cuando tenía 14. A  base de mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante y tener muchos clientes. Rodrigo esta casado y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. 
El esta pidiendo un préstamo para comprar materiales y poder fabricar más producto, ya que viene una buena temporada alta de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story.
Rodrigo is a hard working person who makes backpacks and suitcases for travel. He is 37, and started in this business 23 years ago, when he was 14. Thanks to much effort he has been able to carry his family forward and have many clients. Rodrigo is married and lives with his wife and three sons.
He is asking for a loan to buy materials to be able to make more product, as a good season of high sales is coming.

loans.use: to buy base materials to make backpacks and suitcases.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 61-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as visionary and focused.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell, and she also grows cabbages to sell. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a promising and fertile place and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from six years to 13 years. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy and strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. 

Florence will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 38-year-old woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 to 17 years old. She describes herself as resilient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. It is located in an ideal area for the business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell, and she will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to have a big business with more branches within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 21-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mousa learned how to cut hair in his previous job and now he decided to open a small barber shop in his village. He would like to improve his barber shop.

Mousa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new hair cutting tools and other machines for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Mousa will be able to improve his business and attract more customers. This will increase his income and improve the family's living conditions.

Mousa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new hair cutting tools and other machines for his barber shop.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 46-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from seven years to 18 years. He describes himself to be dedicated and determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale and also sells bulls. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favourable location and his primary customers are butchers, farmers and milk consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of water. 

Daniel will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy animal feed and also to buy a cow. His business goal is to have doubled the number of cows that he has within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business and create more employment for the youth. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and also to buy a cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 35-year-old woman. She describes herself as visionary and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells meat and groceries outside the butchery. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a promising place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and meat for resale. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and meat for resale

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 39-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a shopping centre and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She also does farming to earn extra income. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna72 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Djiguène Bakhna 72 est composé de 5 membres dont 2 femmes et 3 hommes qui habitent tous dans le meme quartier. Madame Ndèye Aminata est leur présidente qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle sollicite  ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et appuie son mari dans la gestion des charges. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir elle souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution agrandir son activité et épargner de l’argent afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 72 group is comprised of five members (two women, three men) who all live in the same area. 

Madame Ndèye Aminata, with her hand raised in the photo, is the group president. She is a wife and mother who sells fruits and vegetables. She is asking for this amount to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband with the management of the expenses. She has more than 10 years experience in this business. She starts her workday at 7 am and ends it at 8 pm. 

In the future, and with the help of the institution, she would like to grow her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: buy and sell various items, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 74 Group
