texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 74  est un groupement d'intérêt économique qui rassemble des gens  du même quartier qui se sont constitués en groupe de crédit grâce à des tontines mensuelles. Ils sont au nombre de 5 et fond tous du commerce et de l’élevage. Avec le crédit, ils vont s’approvisionner en chaussures, habits, pagne, basin… Leur présidente, la dame, Mbène , âgée de 53 ans fait de l’aviculture. Elle désire améliorer son activité en augmentant le nombre de poussin et satisfaire sa clientèle.  Elle gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 20h.
texts.en:
The loan group Djiguène Bakhna 74 is made up of five people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  They established the group through their savings group.  The group members are all traders or work raising livestock.  They will use their loans to buy supplies of shoes, clothing, pagne (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and damask fabric.

Mbène is the group president.  She is 53 years old and works as a poultry farmer.  She would like to improve her business, increase the number of chicks she has and better meet the demands of her customers.

Mbène provides for the day-to-day expenses of her household and the fees for her children.  She has more than ten years' experience in her business, and works from seven in the morning until eight at night.

loans.use: to improve her poultry business and buy more chicks.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 90 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Djiguène Bakhna 90 est composé de 5 personnes qui habitent dans le meme quartier et qui partagent le même réseau de groupement d’intérêt économique. La présidente Aissata est  une promotrice qui évolue dans la commerce depuis plus de 10ans. C’est elle qui a levé l main sur la photo. Elle demande ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter des fruits et légumes destinées  à la vente. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Comme toutes les femmes du réseau, elle souhaite avec l’aide l’institution agrandir son activité  et améliorer les conditions alimentaires.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 90 group is comprised of five people who live in the same area and share the same economic interest network. 

The president, Aissata, is a promoter who has been in business for over 10 years. She has her hand raised in the photo. She is asking for a loan for 100,000 FCFA to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. She starts her workday at 7 am and ends it at 8 pm. 

Like the other women in the network, with the help of the institution, she would like to grow her business and improve her dietary conditions.

loans.use: buy and sell fruits, vegetables, and fishing items.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    MIRIYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  de le village de Sido. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 13ème prêt. Les 12 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de FANTA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des boissons, des pièces de pagne, des draps, des couvertures, des sacs  avec les grossistes  de Cotonou. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The four married women in the Miriya Group are, on average, 53 years old and have four children.  They live in nuclear families in the village of Sido, and know one another through business, friendship and neighbourhood connections.

The group members would like to strengthen their financial situation and improve their businesses, so they work with the field partner Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their thirteenth loan, the previous twelve loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

The women all sell various products.  Fanta (sitting on the right in the photo) will use her loan to buy drinks, pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), sheets and bedding, and bags, from wholesalers in Cotonou.  She sells her products from door-to-door and at the market, to various customers, for cash or on credit.

Fanta expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will invest in her business and use to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es: Bismark, un joven que siempre busca como salir adelante en la vida, ya que es casada padre de una hija pequeña, el es comerciante, vende calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, el credito lo esta solocitando para compra paca de Zapatos mixta para comercializarla e invertir mas en su negocio el tiene un puesto en el mercado ademas viaja a los departamentos a vender, el esta contento por esta nueva oportunidad que le estan brindado Kiva y Afodenic al otorgarle el credito.
texts.en: Bismark is a young man who is always looking for a way to get ahead since he is married and has a small daughter.  He is a merchant and sells women's, men's and children's shoes.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a bundle of mixed shoes to sell since he wants to invest more in his business.  He has a stall at the market and also travels to other departments to sell.  He is happy about this new opportunity to receive a loan through Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Flor De Manzana Group

texts.es:
Chunimá is located in a remote area in the highland area of Chichicastenango Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Manzana” meaning “Apple Blossom” was formed here and consists of eight women whose goal is to improve their lives. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, the ladies receive trainings on useful and essential topics like effective business practices, money management and budgeting, nutrition, health and hygiene as well as identity and leadership.

Maria is a 36 year old member of the group who is on her first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She owns a store where she sells items for daily consumption. The business was started by her father but since he died a few years ago, she inherited the store. She wants to enlarge the business so that she, along with her mother, can increase the inventory and meet theibasic needs. Maria plans to use her loan to purchase more rice, sugar, spices, cooking oil and noodles. She wants to attract new customers and meet the needs of her current customers. Her neighbors prefer to buy from her because of the convenience and proximity of her store. 

On behalf of the Trust Bank, Maria expresses her gratitude to KIVA investors for funding these much needed loans. The ladies are excited about stepping into a brighter future, armed with some education and capital. They visualize themselves as empowered women eliminating poverty. Thank you!
texts.en:
Chunimá is located in a remote area in the highland area of Chichicastenango Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Manzana” meaning “Apple Blossom” was formed here and consists of eight women whose goal is to improve their lives. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, the ladies receive trainings on useful and essential topics like effective business practices, money management and budgeting, nutrition, health and hygiene as well as identity and leadership.

Maria is a 36 year old member of the group who is on her first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She owns a store where she sells items for daily consumption. The business was started by her father but since he died a few years ago, she inherited the store. She wants to enlarge the business so that she, along with her mother, can increase the inventory and meet theibasic needs. Maria plans to use her loan to purchase more rice, sugar, spices, cooking oil and noodles. She wants to attract new customers and meet the needs of her current customers. Her neighbors prefer to buy from her because of the convenience and proximity of her store. 

On behalf of the Trust Bank, Maria expresses her gratitude to KIVA investors for funding these much needed loans. The ladies are excited about stepping into a brighter future, armed with some education and capital. They visualize themselves as empowered women eliminating poverty. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, spices, cooking oil and noodles for her sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To provide maintenance for his citrus crops.

loans.name: Lindiwe

texts.en:
Lindiwe is a young woman aged 24, married and the mother of one residing in Hurungwe District. She is a CAMA member actively involved in empowering school leavers to reinvest into the community by carrying out health and education campaigns. She is currently working as a Camfed Core trainer, training young women on life skills education and business. She operates a small tuck shop in her community where she sells a variety of grocery products such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, and salt. The store is conveniently located since it is the only one in the vicinity. She started the business in 2012 when she realized that as a woman she also needed to play a part in providing for her family.

The Kiva loan will enable her to expand her business by increasing her stock and raising her sales. She sees herself being the leading supplier of grocery products in her village and also hopes to create employment in her community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock and raising her sales

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
21-year-old Brenda is a single mother of one living in Nyanga, Zimbabwe. She is currently renting a stall at the local business center where she sells products such as cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes. She started her business soon after her husband left her so as to provide for her child. By starting the business, it has enabled her to become financially independent. Brenda inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. 

She will use the Kiva loan to increase her stock levels and improve sales. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and her child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 24-year-old businesswoman who is married and living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She owns a grocery shop where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and maputi (roasted corn). 

Priscilla inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide working to improve the learning environment for students and as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for the past year and has managed to employ one person during that time. 

Priscilla will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and provide for other vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Cynthia Munashe

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 24-year-old single young woman. She is currently living in the Chikomba District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. 

Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2009 because she wanted to be financially independent and because she realised that it was very profitable in her community. 

Cynthia would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Fortuna

texts.es:
Fortuna se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca y yuca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar yuca.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Fortuna makes her living selling coca and yucca leaves. She has been doing this business for several years now, and she is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in to her work. She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria" and she needs a loan to buy yucca. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and she is committed to making her monthly payments with a lot of responsibility.

loans.use: to buy yucca.

loans.name: Alicia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Alicia, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Alicia trabaja en una escuela de la localidad como maestra, además en la misma escuela ella en sociedad con su papá son los encargados del bar en el cual venden bocadillos, jugos naturales y varios productos saludables para los niños que llegan a este centro de estudios. También en su casa se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Lleva 7 años con su negocio y gracias a este negocio logro tener su titulo de licenciada y ahora le permite sacar adelante a su hija.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The San Vicente Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for its trade, traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and happy inhabitants.

Alicia lives here. She is 35 years old, and is a single mother to her 13-year-old daughter, who studies at secondary school. She lives with her parents.

Alicia works in a local school as a teacher, and with her father, she is in charge of the snack bar, which sells sandwiches, natural fruit juices, and other healthy snacks for the children who attend this education center. At home, she also works selling phone cards and credit. She has worked in this for seven years, and thanks to it, she managed to complete her teaching degree and can now support her daughter.

She will use this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells. She has been a member of the Credit Group for ten years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans she received, she set up her business. Her dream is to offer her daughter the best of everything.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Juana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras, entre otros productos que le envían desde Los Estados Unidos, Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar donde sus clientes le visitan cada vez que recibe mercadería, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad razón por lo cual ya cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The San Vicente Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for its trade, traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and happy inhabitants.

Juana lives here. She is 56 years old, and is married with four grown-up and independent sons, three of whom she had with her husband. Her husband is a driver. Juana is a housewife, who, in order to make some money of her own and to help out her husband with household expenses, sells clothes, shoes, handbags, and other items which are sent to her from the USA. She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She is a door-to-door seller, and also sells items from her home, which is visited by her customers every time she receives a shipment of goods. She sells her products on credit and collects the money every eight days.

She has been in this business for over ten years, which is why she has a good customer base. She will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been a member of the Credit Group for over ten years and she likes it because the loan repayments are easy to make. Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 24 years old and lives in the town of Muzarabani, Zimbabwe. She is married with two children and volunteers at the local community center. She is currently running a piggery that she started with her husband in 2009. She sells pigs for a living to local slaughterhouses. The business has improved her life drastically and has enabled her to put one of her children through school.

Caroline will use the Kiva loan to purchase a sow and pig feed and increase her earnings on her animal sales. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with the education of her children and help support her ten siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more sows and pig feed.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en: Lana is 21 years old. She is a single lady who lives in a section of Jordan called Irbid. She lives with her three siblings and her parents. Lana is a university student who is majoring in French language. She is in her third year. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. She asks for help as a result of a financial crisis that her family is facing.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is 20 years old. She is a single lady who lives in a section of Jordan called Mafraq. She lives with her three siblings and her parents. Eman is a university student who is majoring in business administration. She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her education journey. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. She asks for this loan as a result of a financial crisis her family is facing.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 20-year-old single mother of one who lives in Chikomba West, a district in Zimbabwe. Her commitment to giving back to the community inspires local youth. She volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide, dedicating her time to teaching students in her community life skills education. Anna rents a table at a local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2012 after having worked at her friend’s flea market. Anna decided to start renting her own table when she felt confident in her selling skills and wanted to be financially independent.

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand. The Kiva loan will enable her to increase her inventory of jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and to support her child.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Tahuantinsuyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAHUANTINSUYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Salome es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de bisutería, panadería, hilado y tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Salome es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar a sus vecinas el desarrollo del negocio y con un pequeño capital que tenía decidió armar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito ágil, la capacitación y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Group "Tahuantinsuyo" is about to start their first business cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Juan Pablo Community Center. This group of entrepreneurs is made up of eight women and is run by a board of directors, of which Salome is president. The group members work in various trades, including: running a convenience store, selling clothing, running a bakery, selling jewelry, sewing and weaving blankets, etc.

The funds from this loan will be put toward the business endeavors of all the group members, including Salome's business. Salome joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is also a member. Salome currently runs a convenience store in her neighborhood, a business she learned by observing a couple of her neighbors in their business endeavors. She eventually decided to pull together what savings she could to open her own store.

With the support from this loan, Salome plans to purchase beer in bulk to stock her convenience store. She buys products for her store from wholesale distributors in El Alto and then sells them at her store. This business is her primary source of income for providing for her family, which includes her husband and two children. When asked what she likes about being a member of Pro Mujer, Salome answered that she likes the flexible credit plans, the training she receives and the health services that Pro Mujer offers as well.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's clothing, as well as a mannequin to improve the image of her business and to display nicely the clothing she has for sale

loans.name: Alliance I Group

texts.fr: Madame Cibalonza, femme ambitieuse est présidente de l’association d’affaire Alliance I. Elle est  commerçante depuis 1997.  A l’âge de 45 ans, elle est mère de  10 enfants  qui vont tous à l’école et est engagée à un homme d’affaire. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de riz et 20 sacs de haricots.  Son rêve est de construire une maison dans la parcelle qu’elle vient d’acheter grâce à ses épargnes. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement Hekima.
texts.en:
Cibalonza, head of the Alliance I business group, is an ambitious woman who has been in business since 1997. She is 45 years old and has ten children, who are all in school, and is engaged to a businessman. 

Cibalonza is requesting another loan to buy 30 sacks of rice and 20 sacks of beans. She hopes to build a house on the plot of land she has just bought with her savings and would like to thank Hekima for its assistance.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of rice and 20 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Tenez Bon Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mishonya est une commerçante  d’une expérience de 14 ans, âgée de 52 ans, veuve responsable et mère de 9 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 2 sont deja mariés. La cliente est présidente et membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Tenez  bon». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de friperie. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant). Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants orphelins. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Our customer Mishonya is a retailer with fourteen years of experience. At age 52,  she is a window in charge of nine children: seven of them are students, and two are already married.

This customer is the presiding member of the business collective “Tenez  bon”. She retails second-hand clothing. She shows her merchandise at the central market of the city. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She will purchase ten bundles of second-hand clothes. She started her business with capital given by her husband, when he was still alive.

In the future, she would like to increase her savings, build a house, and feed and send to school her orphaned children. She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs without banking access, granting them microloans in this period after the war in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to pay for ten extra bundles of second hand clothes

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MARZO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brigith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, artesanía en miniaturas, venta de dulces, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, confección de deportivos, juegos recreativos, venta de electrodomésticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brigith es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados en miniatura; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su pareja, posterior a aprender las técnicas de decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "6 de Marzo" communal bank is beginning its fifth loan cycle at "Pro Mujer" through the Senkata regional office. This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors that has Brigith as president. The members have different kinds of business, including: selling clothes, sweets, make-up, electrical appliances and bread, miniature handicrafts and making sports clothes.

This loan will benefit the small businesses in Brigith's group. Brigith herself tells us that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, following an invitation from a friend at the organisation who went to visit her at home. Brigith currently has a business selling miniature shoes. She learned this trade from her partner and, on doing so, decided to start her own business.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying leather in bulk from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. It will then be used to make her products at her shop. This work allows Brigith to earn money to support her family; she has a partner and three children.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer", Brigith tells us that she likes the training and the savings that are offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy leather in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various type of snacks, such as candy, chips, bread, beans, noodles, and various types of biscuits.

loans.name: Fatima Petrona

texts.es:
Fátima de  57 años, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es  originaria de Quezalguaque municipio de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de su familia. Y pasar tiempo con ellos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día por sus hijos, para brindarle las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener, para hacer de ellos personas profesionales  y de esa forma contribuir a la sociedad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pulpería, es una tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, fósforos, tiste, jabón, detergente. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Fátima, 57, is the single mother of two minor children.  She's from Quezalguaque, a town in León, located in the western part of the country.  She's known for being hardworking and responsible, and she wants to improve herself personally.  In her free time Fátima likes to enjoy her family and spend time with them.  Unfortunately she wasn't able to study for a career because she lacked the financial resources.  Currently she strives every day to give her children the opportunities she wasn't able to have, so they can become professionals and contribute to society.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Fátima has a pulpería, a store that sells small quantities of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, matches, "tiste" [a beverage], soap, and detergent.  She tends the store and sells her products about 12 hours a day.

The goal of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling food products so she can earn better income in the near future.

Fátima's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ana Belky

texts.es:
Ana Belky de 32 años de edad, soltera sin hijos es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gustas disfrutar con su familia le prepara platos típicos como ¨ indio viejo´´ lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para lograr establecer su estabilidad economica.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano como: pantalones, short, faldas, blusas, sobrecamas, edredones, alfombras, ropa de niño, ropa interior. Ella  dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda  obtener mejores ingresos. Ana Belky agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana Belky is 32 years old, single with no children, and is from Sauce, a place located in a northern area of the region. She is known as a hard worker, responsible, with a strong desire for self-improvement. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family preparing typical dishes like "indio viejo". Unfortunately, she could not pursue a career and has felt obligated to work from a young age to help with the expenses of the house. She fights every day to establish herself economically.

Thanks to her hard efforts and desire to succeed, she has an economic activity of selling second-hand clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, bedspreads, quilts, rugs, children's clothes, underwear.. She spends 10 hours a day doing this activity and offering her products. This credit will be used to invest in working capital for her business and stock her store by buying second-hand items so that in the not-far future, she can increase her profits. Ana Belky is thankful for the help of Kiva lenders that provide for poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua and allow them to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to stock her store with second-hand items such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, bedspreads, quilts, rugs, children's clothes, underwear

loans.name: Flores De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE VENTILLA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cotillones, elaboración de tarimas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de pollos, librería, venta de golosinas, servicio de conducción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sara es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al apoyar a su madre en su negocio, posterior a aprender las técnicas de decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Flores de Ventilla" communal bank is beginning its third loan cycle at "Pro Mujer" through the Senkata regional office. This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors that has Sara as president. The members have different kinds of business, including: selling meals, knitting sweaters, selling chickens, a bookshop, selling sweets, making flooring and offering driving services.

This loan will benefit the small businesses in Sara's group. Sara herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" three years ago, following an invitation from a friend at the organisation who went to visit her at home. Sara currently has a business selling meals. She learned this trade by supporting her mother with her business and after learning the skills decided to start up her own business.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying groceries in bulk from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. They will then be used to make her meals at her business. This work allows Sara to earn money to support her family; she has a partner and three children.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer", Brigith tells us that she likes the health training that is offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nyarai

texts.en:
Nyarai is 28 years old, and married with two children. She resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. 

Nyarai volunteers at community centres where she assists students with their studies through cooperative learning groups. She also provides psycho-social support to students facing challenges. In addition, Nyarai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now, and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the loan from Kiva, Nyarai intends to increase her stock and improve sales. 

She aspires to own her own shop one day and be in a position to employ young women in the community who are currently unemployed. 

Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will also bring stability to her business, and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her stock

loans.name: Regedzai

texts.en:
Regedzai is 27 years old and married with one child. She currently resides in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. 

Regedzai volunteers as Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students valuable life and study skills. She is an inspiring entrepreneur who buys and sells plastic products such as buckets, laundry dishes, and cutlery racks. She also sells clothing accessories such as shirts, skirts, shorts, and towels. She has been running the business for the past four months now, and it has provided her with a stable source of income which enables her to support herself and her child. 
 
With a Kiva loan, Regedzai will expand her business by purchasing green products (plastic products) from recycling companies to promote green living in her community. 

Profits accrued from the business will be used to improve her standard of living, as well as cater to the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
30-year-old Juliet is married with two children and lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She is an aspiring entrepreneur who buys and sells plastic products, such as buckets, laundry dishes, and cutlery racks. She also sells clothing accessories such as shirts, skirts, shorts, and towels. She began her business three years ago, when she realized she needed a stable source of income when she finished school in order to support herself and her family.  

Juliet will use the loan from Kiva to expand her business by purchasing additional plastic products in bulk from recycling companies to promote green living in her community. 

She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Lago Sagrado Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAGO SAGRADO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pesca, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, y ella ya tiene treinta años en él, cuando se casó decide emprender su negocio independiente para generar mayores recursos:
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes de pesca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará los mismo en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen hace falta un compañero, sin embargo nos acompaña su madre quien tiene un sombrero cafe.
texts.en:
The comunal bank “Lago Sagrado” [Sacred Lake] will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer, in its regional office of Achacachi. It is composed of eight members and led by a board where Angélica is the president. The members have different activities, such as fishing, fish sales and grocery stores.

This loan will be helpful for small entrepreneurs like Angélica. She says this is the first time she is a member of Pro Mujer. She was invited to join by a promoter who came to her house. Angélica works in fishing. She says that this has been the family’s main activity and that she has a thirty-year experience. When she got married, she decided to start her own business in order to make more profits.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital. She will buy fishing nets from the wholesalers at the city of El Alto. She will then install them in her fishing area. This business helps her to have an income to support her family; she is married and has seven children.

She says that what she likes the most about Pro Mujer is the loans they offer. One of the members is missing in the picture, but his mother is replacing him (she is wearing a brown hat).

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Chenai

texts.en:
Chenai is 35 years old, married with one child, and living in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe where she provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. 

She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary. 

She will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her supplies. 

She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and provide for other vulnerable children in the community. 

Chenai inspires young women in her community as a successful entrepreneur. She started the business to empower herself economically, and earn a stable income.

loans.use: To increase supplies

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 30 years old and lives in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children.

Along with other vibrant young women in her community, Juliet is actively leading the initiative to keep children in school. To earn an income, she runs a family business she started with her husband in 2012, raising chickens and selling them to the community. She is currently producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks. She loves her business and hopes to expand it. 

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. 

Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha, a single mother of two, is 25 years old and living in Chikomba West district in Zimbabwe. She volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school, and assists the elderly in her community. 

Bertha rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags and shoes. She started her business in April last year to support her family and three of her dependents through school, since she is the bread winner. 

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business, and would like to expand her business. 

The loan will assist her to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell. 

She hopes to raise enough money to support her three dependents.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her stock

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en:
Chiedza is a 27-year-old woman; she is married with two children. She lives in Chikomba West district in Zimbabwe. 

Chiedza volunteers in schools as a Camfed Learner Guide, where she teaches students about their wellbeing. She is currently running a gardening business which she started in 2012 after she realized that it wasn’t enough to teach people about health; she wanted to help them eat healthy foods and live healthy lives as well. 

The business has also allowed her to pay for school fees for her children and provide food for her family. Chiedza sells various types of vegetables such as covo, onions, tomatoes, spinach, cassava, sweet potatoes, and carrots to people in her community. 

Chiedza sees a good opportunity to grow her business. There are no fruit and vegetable shops in her area, so she dreams of opening her own shop to meet the needs of her community.  She even hopes to hire employees.  

This Kiva loan will give her a chance to take her enterprise to the next level by purchasing seeds for her garden.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for her garden

loans.name: Applonia

texts.en:
Applonia is a 27-year-old single mother of one currently living in Chikomba West, Zimbabwe. She sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts and shoes at the local business centre. 

Applonia inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their well being, and as an entrepreneur. She started the business in 2013 when she finished school so that she could provide for herself. 

She will use the loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock. 

An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well being.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 30-year-old business woman. She is married with three children, living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. 

As a Camfed Learner Guide, Emily has the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2011 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Emily loves her business, and would very much like to increase her production capacity to become a supplier to major supermarkets. This means that she would have to enlarge her fowl run, and use the loan to purchase more chemicals, chick feed, broiler concentrate, and fencing. 

This Kiva loan would allow Emily to purchase these items. She hopes to put her three children and two cousins through school.

loans.use: to purchase more fencing, chick feed and chemicals

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the District of Chikomba in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children. 

She volunteers in schools, disseminating health information to students. Irine also runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, shoes, and baby diapers. She started her business in 2012 to support her family and improve her standard of living after her husband lost his job.

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business, and would like it to expand. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to get more jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings and family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi is a 25-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house in the city. Hamdi is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. He decided to buy a new rickshaw to work on. This will help him to cover part of the family's expenses. 

Hamdi took out a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw and start to transfer goods in the local market. By taking this loan, Hamdi will be able to find a new source of income and improve the family's living conditions. 

Hamdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw and start to transfer goods in the local market.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is 33 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and his five children; many years ago, he took courses to be able to repair phones, and he has good experience now. He opened his workshop three years ago.

He needs this loan to buy a computer to buy repair equipment, which will make his work easier and provide more time and effort. This will increase his income, and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family. He wishes to be able to give his children good living conditions, and to see them become educated and successful people.  

Sameer wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success; he believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy repair equipment, which will make his work easier and provide more time and effort. This will increase his income, and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.

loans.name: Abd Al Raziq

texts.en:
Abd Al Raziq is 41 years old. He has a shop for selling and repairing phones. He lives with his wife and his five children in Gaza. They live in Balata Camp, a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank. 

He worked in many shops to gain some experience, then after many years he decided to open his own workshop. He needs this loan to buy inventory to sell and repair phone equipment, which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

Abd Al Raziq wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success; he believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell and repair phone equipment, which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is 33 years old, married, and lives in Ramallah, with her husband, and she has one child. She started her beauty salon business one year ago. She was working in another salon as an employee, so she has a good experience in this field. 

Haya asked Ryada for this loan to buy a device to clean the skin of the face, which will make her salon differ from others. This will attract the customers, and this will lead also to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

Her dream is to expand her business more and more in the future. She also desires to use part of the profits on her child's education in the future. She is very grateful to everyone.

loans.use: to buy a device for cleaning the skin of the face.

loans.name: Rehan

texts.en:
Rehan is 38 years old. He lives in Ramallah with his wife and three children; two of them attend the primary school. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it in 2008.

Rehan is requesting this loan to purchase a refrigerator. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal to become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business, and he desires to use part of the profits for his children’s education in the future. Rehan is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, allowing him to be able to increase his stock.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is 58 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it 2 years ago.

Waleed has applied for this loan to purchase a display box, shelves and a refrigerator. This will allow him to increase his stock and will lead to an increase in the number of clients and an increase in his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

His dream is to expand his business. Waleed is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display box, shelves and a refrigerator. This will allow him to increase his stock.

loans.name: Wa'el

texts.en:
Wa'el is 37 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife, three sons and one daughter. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it 2 years ago.

He is requesting this loan to purchase a refrigerator and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business, and he wants to use part of the profits on his children’s future education. Wa'el is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and shelves in order to increase his stock.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in Gaza.

He has a poultry farm, and he earns a monthly income of US$626. He started his business in 2009.

He needs this youth loan to buy a water tank and a new chicken-plucking machine, which will help him to improve his financial conditions, support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Wissam is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a new chicken-plucking machine

loans.name: Falasteen

texts.en: Falasteen is a 24-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children in a small house. Currently, she has a business, weaving and selling woolens. She works at home. She started this trade four years ago, learning her technique in workshop classes. In the beginning, it was like a hobby and later, she decided to treat it as a business, besides her study. The youth loan she is currently taking out is to buy a sewing machine, which will improve her work, making it faster and increasing quality. She sells her products in shops and directly to her customers. This allows her to generate income to support her family. Falasteen is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwafaq

texts.en:
Mwafaq is 29 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and three children. He opened a small "blacksmith” workshop in 2010. He specializes in manufacturing doors and windows; this business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Mwafaq is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this youth loan to buy a new machine for his workshop that will allow him to expand. He will also use the loan to hire another laborer to help him, because his customer base is increasing constantly. Mwafaq is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his workshop that will allow him to expand and hire another laborer to help him fill increasing demand

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is 24 years old. He lives in Gaza with his family, only one of whom is employed and helping in providing the family with income, so he works hard to provide good living conditions for them. On the first of May 2011, Atef opened his own barbershop; he is very well-known now.

Atef asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair and barber tools for his shop. This will increase the number of the clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.  

Atef is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and barber tools for his shop. This will increase the number of clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.

loans.name: La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mali est une trésorerie de l’association d’affaire la sagesse.  Entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 28 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un homme d’affaire. La cliente est une vendeuse ambulante des yaourts depuis 2006. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 10 bidons de 20litres de yaourt. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants obtenir leurs diplômes universitaires et ouvrir une cafétéria.
texts.en:
Mali is the Treasurer for the business group 'La Sagesse'.  She is a 28-year-old entrepreneur with four children who are all studying.  Her husband is a businessman.

Mali has been selling yogurt on foot since 2006.  This new loan will allow her to buy ten 20-litre drums of yogurt.  

In the future, Mali would like to see her children receive university diplomas, and she would like to open and run a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy ten 20-litre drums of yogurt for resale.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is 23 years old. She is a single lady living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her 4 brothers and her parents. Nisreen is a university student majoring in English Literature. She is in her 3rd year. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester's fees after she noticed the financial crisis her family is facing.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester's fees

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 21-year-old woman who is married with one child. She lives in the District of Chikomba West in Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools disseminating health information to students. Millicent also runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2013 to support her child and siblings because she is the main breadwinner in the family. 

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand. The Kiva loan will assist her to get more jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings and family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her inventory.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A Sra: Carolina , solteira e mae de 6  filhos todos sao independente. Ela è agricultora de subisistencia e  vende os produtos a porta da sua machamba ( campo de producao).
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao(cimento, blocos, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como garande desafio melhorar as condicos de habitacao.
texts.en:
Carolina is unmarried and has six children, all of whom live on their own. She is a subsistence farmer and sells her products at the entrance to her farm.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.
Her biggest challenge is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Carolina Jose

texts.pt:
A Sra: Carolina de 28 anos de idade, casada e mae de 3 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario . Ela faz scouting numa empresa de producao de banana. 
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao(cimento, blocos, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como garande desafio melhorar as condicos de habitacao.
texts.en:
Carolina, 28 years old, is married and has three children who are in elementary school. She does scouting for a banana company. 
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.
Her biggest challenge is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Zaida Januario

texts.pt:
A Sra: Zaida de 25 anos de idade, solteira . Ela faz scouting numa empresa de producao de banana. 
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao(cimento, blocos, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como garande desafio melhorar as condicos  habitacionais e melhorar as condioes de vida
texts.en:
Zaida, 25 years old, is unmarried. She does scouting for a banana company. 
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.
Her biggest goals are to improve her home and work toward a better life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Lucia Antonio

texts.pt:
A Sra: Lucia de 29 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 2 filhos dos quais 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola . Ela faz scouting numa empresa de producao de banana. 
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao(cimento, blocos, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.seu desafio actual e melhorar as condicoes habitacioanais
texts.en:
Lucia, 29 years old, is unmarried and has two children, one of whom is in elementary school and the other of whom is not yet of school age. She does scouting for a banana company. 
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house. Her current goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Penina

texts.pt:
A Sra: Penina de 61 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 5 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e 2 sao independentes. Ela faz agricultura subsistencia em culturas de milho, amendoim e diversos. Actualmente explora uma machamba de aproximadamente 2 hectares e  suas culturas vende a porta da sua machamba.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar insumos agricolas (adubos, vitaminas,sementes e pagamento de lavora da machamba) para aumentar a sua produtividade e assegurar a sua reforma. seu deseafio e continuara a trabalhar para garantir o sustento familiar
texts.en:
Penina, 61 years old, is unmarried and has five children, three of whom are in elementary and secondary school, and two of whom are now adults. She is a subsistence farmer growing corn, peanuts, and other crops. She currently cultivates a two-hectare farm and sells her products at the entrance to the farm.
She will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, vitamins, seeds) and pay laborers for the farm to increase her productivity and improve her business. Her challenge is to keep working to make sure she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, vitamins, seeds) and pay laborers for her farm.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and beans. She also keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unpredictable weather. 

Alice will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to do extensive farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a prosperous farmer. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan  was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kalimurhima Group

texts.fr: Madame Mawazo est présidente du groupe d’affaire Kalimurhima.  Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle est âgée de 39 ans et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse de la farine de manioc depuis 2010. Elle installe ses produits au marché public. Ce nouveau prêt va permettre l’accroissement de son capital en achetant 6 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite évoluer dans ses activités et devenir grossiste. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Mawazo is the president of the business group 'Kalimurhima'.  She is 39 years old, mother to four children who all attend school, and is very experienced in business.  She has been selling cassava flour since 2010 at the public market.

This new loan will increase her working capital and allow Mawazo to buy six sacks of cassava flour for resale.

In the future, Mawazo would like to develop her business and become a wholesaler.

She is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima, for offering support to women who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is 29 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his two brothers and his parents. He has been working as a taxi driver which is a weak source of income, so he decided to continue his studies to get his Bachelor's and find a better job after graduation. Tariq is now a university student majoring in Economics and Business. He is in his third year. He noticed his family struggling through a financial crisis during this period. So he has applied for an educational loan to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham was born in 1990. She is married and has one son.  Her husband works at a hotel.  Reham has a blanket retail business that she works from home to support herself and to help her husband pay some of the household bills. She applied for this youth loan to buy more blankets which might raise her profits.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Argentina Felisberto

texts.pt:
A  Sr: Argentina 45 de  anos de idade, casada e mae  de 5 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequenter a escola no ensino primario e secundario e os 2 sao independente . Ela è negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar ( arroz, refregerante, feijao manteiga, tomate e diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio, actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 20 anos junto com os seus filhos. Seu esposo è operario agricula numa empresa de producao de Banana.
Tem como desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Argentina, 45 years old, is married and has five children, three of whom are in elementary and secondary school, and two of whom are now adults. She has an informal business selling staple goods from a shop out of her home.
She will use this loan to buy rice, soft drinks, beans, butter, tomatoes, and other products to increase her stock. She and her children have run this business for more than twenty years. Her husband is an agricultural worker at a banana company.
Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions and income.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, beans, butter, tomatoes, and other products to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, trawling line, and other supplies so he can expand the area he fishes in.

loans.name: Cristina Alberto

texts.pt:
A Sr: Cristina de 41 anos de idade, viuva e mae de  de 4 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e um e independente. Ela è agricultora informal de produtos de milho, mandioca, cebola e mais.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimemto, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para reabilitar a sua casa que se encontra no estado mais avancado de degradacao. Seu desafio e melhorrar as condicionais habitacioanias para uma melhorar comodidade para a familia
texts.en:
Cristina, 41 years old, is a widow and has four children, three of whom are in elementary and secondary school, and one of whom is now adult. She is a small farmer growing corn, manioc, onions, and other crops.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, stone) and pay for labor to refurbish her home, which is extremely dilapidated. Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions and offer them a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, stone) and pay for labor to refurbish her home, which is extremely dilapidated.

loans.name: Marcelina Eriqueta

texts.pt:
A Sar: Marceline de 22 anos de idade, casada e mae de 2 filhos dos quais 1 esta a frequenter a escola no ensino primario a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è negociante informal de mantas, lençoĕs  e de diversos vistuario, actividade que esta a exercer junto com a sua maĕ.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar (lencoes, mantas e diverso vestuario) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.Seu maior desafio e melhorara a renda familiar com o incremento do volume do negocio
texts.en:
Marcelina, 22 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in elementary school and the other of whom is not yet of school age. She has an informal business with her mother selling wraps, headscarves, and other articles of clothing.
She will use this loan to buy wraps, headscarves, and other articles of clothing to increase their business's stock. Her biggest goal is to improve her family's income by increasing her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy wraps, headscarves, and other articles of clothing to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Carolina  Pucane

texts.pt:
A Sra: Carolina de 51 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 4 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario  e secundario os 2  sao independente. Ela è empacotadora numa empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para terminar com a construcao da sua casa.O seu desafio neste momento e  conclusao da obra para dar mais conforto a familia
texts.en:
Carolina, 51 years old, is unmarried and has six children, four of whom are in elementary and secondary school, and two of whom are now adults. She works as a baler for a banana company.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to finish the construction on her house. Her current goal is to finish the construction so she can provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and pay for labor to finish the construction on her house.

loans.name: Catarina Zacarias

texts.pt:
A Sra: Catarina  de 30 anos de idade, casada e mae de 3  filhos dos quais todos estao a frequenter a escola no ensino primario e secundario . Ela è negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade e vestuario.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar ( blocos, cimento, pedra, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa. seu maior desafio e melhorar as condicinais habitacionais
texts.en:
Catarina, 30 years old, is married and has three children, all of whom are in elementary and secondary school. She has an informal business selling staple goods and clothing.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder stone, beams) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house. Her biggest goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder stone, beams) and pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Judite Salomao

texts.pt:
A  Sra: Judite  de 33 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4  filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequenter a escola no ensino primario e secundario a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar ( arroz, refregerante, feijao manteiga, tomate e diversos produtos da primeira necessidade) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa.Seu maior desafio e crescer no seu negocio aumentado desta forma a renda familiar
texts.en:
Judite, 33 years old, is married and has four children, three of whom are in elementary school and the other of whom is not yet of school age. She has an informal business selling staple goods and clothing.
She will use this loan to buy rice, soft drinks, butter beans, tomatoes, and other staple goods to increase the volume of business in the shop she runs out of her house. Her biggest goal is to expand her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, butter beans, tomatoes, and other staple goods to increase the volume of business in her shop.

loans.name: Geremias Francisco

texts.pt:
O  Sr: Geremias  de 42 anos de idade, casado e pai  de 4  filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequenter a escola no ensino primario e secundario a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade no seu estabelicimento comercial.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar ( arroz, refregerante, feijao manteiga, tomate e diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio, actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 15 anos junto com a sua esposa.
Tem como desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Geremias, 42 years old, is married and has four children, three of whom is in elementary school and the other of whom is not yet of school age. He has an informal business selling staple goods in his shop.
He will use this loan to buy rice, soft drinks, butter beans, tomatoes, and other products to increase his stock. He and his wife have run this business for more than fifteen years.
His biggest goal is to improve his family’s living conditions and diet.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, butter beans, tomatoes, and other products to increase his business's stock.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.pt:
E casado e tem 3 filhos, vive na casa propria. Ele trabalha para o Ministerio de Educacao.
Com o presente empréstimo ele vai adiquirir material de construção o ferro, o cimento e a pedra para dar continuidade com a obra. Tem como desafio concluir sua residencia de forma a garantir uma melhor comodidade a familia
texts.en:
Rosario is married and has three children. He lives in his own home. He works for the Ministry of Education.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, and stone) to continue building his house. His goal is to finish his home so he can provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, and stone) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Angela

texts.pt:
A Senhora Ângela tem 2 filhos e todos andam na escola. Ela trabalha na educação como docente. 
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, varrões de fero e area) para fazer acabamentos da sua casa.O seu maior sonho é concluir a faculdade.
O maior desafio é o custo elevado do material de construção.
texts.en:
Ângela has two children, both of whom are in school. She works in education as a teacher. 
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, iron bars, and sand) to finish the construction on her house. Her biggest dream is to finish college.
The main challenge she faces is the high cost of construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, iron bars, and sand) to finish the construction on her house.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus is 28-years-old, married and has four daughters. Elbrus is an IDP, an Internally Displaced Person, from  Fuzuli city.  Today, he lives with his lovely family in the Baku region. His elder daughter goes to first grade at school, all the other children are young and go to kindergarten. Elbrus has been in the animal breeding business for 10 years. He learned this profession from his father and his wife helps him with the business. They make different dairy products from milk and then they sell them.  They also sell meat. Today, to increase the family business, Elbrus needs a loan of 1,550 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy little calves. He is very thankful for the Kiva organization and its lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy little calves

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina vive en casa de su padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en La Paz. El oficio que desempeña edicion de afiches, invitaciones y otros. Yanina necesita el crédito para la compra de papel, placas y otros y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Yanina es poder tener casa propia y que su negocio cresca
texts.en: Yanina lives in her parents' house in a brick finish and with cement floors in La Paz. The job she works at is printing posters, invitations and other items.
