Yanina needs the loan to buy paper, plates, and other items and, thus be able to expand her income. Yanina's dream is to be able to have her own house and that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and other supplies for her print shop.

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es: Mayde ahora tiene pareja pero sigue viviendo en casa de sus familiares ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de Palomar. Si antes estaba colaborando a sus padres con el negocio de produccion de leche, ella quiere tener por su cuenta su negocio de semillas, por eso necesita crédito, para comprar semillas mejoradas que faciliten su producción y no necesiten mucho riego. Ella sabe lo que esta haciendo por lo que se aconseja darle una oportunidad
texts.en: Mayde now has a spouse but she continues living in her family home, occupying only one room with brick walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the town of Palomar. Before she was helping her parents with the dairy production business. She wants to have her own seed business so she needs a loan to buy improved seeds that facilitate production and don't need a lot of irrigation. She knows what she is doing so it is adviseable to give her a try.

loans.use: to buy improved seed for her own business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalia no esta casada pero tiene pareja. Rosalia es madre de un hijo y vive con los padres de su pareja en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa alquilada de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con servicios de luz, agua y alcantarillado. Rosalia es comerciante de ropa y solicita el credito para comprar ropa de varon y de mujer (tallas de adulto) para incrementar el volumen de sus ventas. La pareja de Rosalia le ayuda con los gastos de la casa pero no gana lo suficiente como para ayudarle con su negocio de ropa, por eso, Rosalia necesita su colaboración para seguir adelante.
texts.en: Rosalia is not married but has a partner. Rosalia is mother to one child and lives with her partner's parents in the city of La Paz in a rented brick and cement house that has light, water and sewer utilities. Rosalia is a clothes trader and is requesting the loan to buy men's and women's clothing (adult sizes) to increase the volume of sales. Rosalia's partner helps her with the expenses of the household but he does not earn enough to help her with the clothes business. So, Rosalia needs your collaboration to move forward.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing (adult sizes) for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Linner

texts.en:
Linner is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and maize. She also keeps cows. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. 

Linner describes her biggest business challenge to be unpredictable weather. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to do large-scale farming within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan  was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to hire more land for farming.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. She is married and she is mother of two sons. Her elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation and from there he greatly provides for his family. Her second son is passing his military service in the army. Kaine’s husband works as a teacher at the driving school and at the same time he works at a gas station as a serviceman. Karine is also employed. She used to work at the Ijevan military unit as a cook, but now she works at the Ijevan wine factory as a worker. Besides these jobs Karine is busy with framing and agriculture. Already 10 years they are engaged in swine breeding. They have a lot of piglets, some of which she sells before the New Year holidays, which brings in a decent income for her family. Karine keeps her piglets in a barn near their building where they live. 
She asks for a loan of 650.000 Armenian drams to buy another pig and animal fodder for her piglets.

loans.use: to buy a pig and animal fodder for her piglets

loans.name: Utaratibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zihalirwa est  vice présidente du groupe Utaratibu. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 50 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un homme d’affaire. La cliente est une vendeuse de matelas depuis 2008 et installe ses affaires au marché central. Ce nouveau prêt va acheter 8 matelas. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle. Elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Zihalirwa is the vice president of the Utaratibu Group.  She is a dynamic, 50-year-old woman, with eight children who all attend school.  Her husband is a businessman. 

Zihalirwa has been selling mattresses since 2008, at the central market.  This new loan will be used to buy eight mattresses for resale.  She hopes this will enable her to educate her children, expand her business and buy a plot of land.

Zihalirwa is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs to become independent.

loans.use: to buy 8 mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Tudumu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati est présidente de l’association d’affaire Tudumu. Entrepreneur expérimentée, elle est âgée de 39 ans, mère de 9 enfants qui étudient et mariée à un conjoint sans travail. La cliente est vendeuse des céréales au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de sa grande sœur avant de bénéficier du credit de Hekima. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 10 sacs de farine de manioc et 10 sacs de farine de mais. Ainsi, elle projette devenir grossiste et remercie fortement Hekima la soutenir.
texts.en:
Bahati, age 39, is president of Tudumu Group. She's an experienced entrepreneur and the mother of nine children who are studying. She's married and her husband is unemployed.

Bahati sells cereals at the public market. She started her business with help from her older sister, before benefiting from a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima.

With this new loan, she intends to buy 10 sacks of tapioca and 10 sacks of wheat flour. She plans to become a wholesaler and thanks Hekima strongly for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of tapioca and 10 sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mawazo est membre de l’association de crédit Ufunuo. Femme ambitieuse,à 36 ans; elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers en plastics et installe ses affaires au marché central. Le credit sollicité  va lui servir à l’achat de 36 paires des souliers en plastics. Elle souhaite étendre son projet de commerce. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes en les aidants à améliorer leurs conditions de vie surtout le plan (économique, social et spirituel).
texts.en:
Mawazo, age 36, is a member of Ufunuo Group and an ambitious woman. She's married and her husband is unemployed. She's the mother of six school-attending children.

Mawazo sells plastic shoes and sets up her products at the central market. The loan she's seeking will be used to buy 36 pairs of plastic shoes.

She wishes to expand her business. She thanks Hekima for supporting women by helping them improve their standard of living, especially on a economical, social and spiritual level.

loans.use: to buy 36 pairs of plastic shoes

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luhusa est présidente du groupe de credit Baraka. Dynamique et ambitieuse, elle est  âgée de 50 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle s’entraide avec son conjoint dans les affaires et vendent des articles divers. Elle debuta ses affaires avec l’aide d’une amie avant de rejoindre Hekima. Le credit sollicité va acheter 1 carton de rames des papiers, 1 carton de bic, 2 cartons de craies, 3 douzaines de papier hygiénique et papier mouchoir. Son rêve est de voir ses enfants finir les études universitaires, leur assurer un avenir bien meilleur et devenir grossiste. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima au nom de toutes les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Luhusa, age 50, is the president of Baraka Group. She's energetic and ambitious, and the mother of nine children, who all go to school. She and her husband help each other in their business and sell various products.

She started her business with help from a friend, before joining Kiva's partner, Hekima. The loan she's seeking will be used to buy one box of paper reams, one box of pens, two boxes of chalk sticks, three dozen rolls of toilet paper, and paper tissues.

Her dream is to see her children complete their university studies, make sure they get a much better future, and become a wholesaler. She therefore thanks Hekima in the name of all the poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to buy paper reams, pens, chalk sticks, toilet paper, and paper tissues.

loans.name: Rhuzusanye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu est conseillère du groupement de crédit Rhuzusanye. Veuve forte et courageuse, elle est âgée de 66 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui n’étudient pas faute des moyens. La cliente est une vendeuse de farine de sorgho. Elle installe sa marchandise au marché public et parfois à domicile. Le credit demandé servira à moudre les sorghos qu’elle vient de produire pour son activité. Ainsi, elle souhaite évoluer dans le credit pour stabiliser son activité et construire une maison. Elle ne rencontre pas des difficultés dans l’exercice de son activité mais déplore sa situation de locataire à son âge. Enfin, elle exprime sa joie pour Hekima à cause du soutien aux femmes.
texts.en:
Nankafu, age 66, is a counselor with Rhuzusanye Group. She's a strong and courageous widow, and the mother of three children who don't study due to lack of means.

Nankafu sells flour and sorghum. She sets up her products at the public market, and sometimes at her home. The loan she's seeking will be used to grind sorghum that she just produced for her business.

She thusly hope to stabilize her business and build a house. She doesn't experience difficulties in running her business, but regrets being a tenant at her age.

In the end, she expresses her joy for Hekima, because of its support towards women.

loans.use: to grind sorghum to make flour

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нуржамал - высшее образование, окончила институт, по специальности -бухгалтер, в настоящее время - домохозяйка. Вместе с мужем и детьми Нуржамал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуржамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 35 овец, 2 бычка, также обрабатывает 1,92 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. В год получают около 4000 кг фасоли. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного мероприятия для младшего сына.
texts.en:
Nurjamal is 46 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising two children. Nurjamal has an advanced education, she is a college graduate with an accounting degree.  Currently, she is working as a homemaker.  With the help of her husband and her children, she raises cattle and grows crops, a business that she started in 1999 with a purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).  

Thanks to Nurjamal's hard work, she currently has 2 cows, 35 sheep, and 2 calves.  In addition, she is cultivating 1.92 hectares of land to grow beans.  Her annual harvest is 4,000 kg of beans.  She sells the harvested produce to bulk re-sellers.  Her annual income from the business is 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her enterprise, Nurjamal turned to the bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase additional cows.  She is planning to keep the cows in a barn on her own property.  In the summer, the cows will be tended to by the shepherd. Some profits from her business, Nurjamal plans to reinvest and use to increase the size of her herd, the other part she plans to save for the wedding celebration of her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 31 years old. She is a single lady living in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her three siblings and her parents. Lina is a Diploma student majoring in physiology. She works at an accessories store which is a weak source of income, so she decided to continue her studies and find a better job after graduation. 

Lina is in her first year which is the beginning of her education journey. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay her upcoming semester fees after she noticed the financial crisis her family are facing.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a married woman who was born in 1986. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla with her husband, four sons and a daughter. Randa has been raising sheep and selling their products for four years. She started her project selling a few sheep. Now she seeks to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of sheep in order to raise their productivity, which will lead to a raise in her sales and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 20-years-old.  She is a single lady living in a sector in Jordan, called Irbid, with her four brothers and her parents.  She is a university student majoring in Arabic Literature. She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her study journey. She also works in sales at an air conditioning company. Halima has noticed the financial crisis her family has been facing which pushed her to get her bachelors in order to find a better job that will allow her to support her family financially. Because she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Wendranigyande Group

texts.fr:
FATIMATA  est responsable du groupe WENDRANIGYANDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques, du savon et des tubes de pommades et de poudres depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes  et hommes du quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 08douzaines de plats.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux entretenir  sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatimata is the representative of the Wendranigyande Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has four children between the ages of six and fourteen years old.  All of her children currently attend school.

Fatimata has been selling plastic containers, soap, tubes of cream and powders for eleven years.  She buys her supplies at a local market and sells to men and women in her neighbourhood.

Fatimata would like to buy eight dozen containers with her loan.  She will reinvest her profit into her business.

In the future, she would like to expand the nature of her business and be able to provide better for her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 dozen containers for resale.

loans.name: Lealtad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LEALTAD” iniciará el trigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de víveres, salón de belleza, cotillonería, venta de comida, venta de helado, repostería, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de helados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al apoyar a su esposo, a quien trabajaba en el mismo negocio, posterior a aprender las técnicas decide emprender un  negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ambiente para la venta) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente se instará en él, ya que en la actualidad ella vende de forma ambulante sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Lealtad community bank is starting their 30th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center.  The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board, of which Mónica is the president.  The members have various businesses, including: supply sales, a beauty salon, a party supply store, food sales, ice cream sales, a pastry shop, and blanket sales.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit all of their small businesses, including Mónica's.  She has been a member of Pro Mujer for six years, and joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  She has a business selling ice creams.  She started the business to support her husband, who does the same work.  Once she learned techniques from him, she opened her own business.

She is requesting this loan for working capital to purchase merchandise to sell.  She will purchase it in the markets in El Alto, and later sell them, since she sells her products as a street vendor.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loans and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 23 year old single woman.  She describes herself to be committed.  She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years.  Her business is located in an area fit for this business. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad debt.  She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes for resale.  Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a 53 year old married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from eight years to 20 years. She describes herself as determined. Leah operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables, cereals and other items to sell. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, cereals and other items to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman.  She has 3 children.  She describes herself to be honest.  She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal and bananas.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal.  Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Rhusezanye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Gurhahoza est un leader du groupement d’affaire Rhusezanye. Femme mariée, son conjoint est un cultivateur. Elle est  mère de 6 enfants dont seulement 2 sont scolarisés faute des moyens. La cliente est vendeuse de mais et des avocats et cela depuis plus 30 ans. Elle installe ses produits au marché public le week end et pendant la semaine dans la rue et parfois à son domicile. Ce nouveau prêt va l’aider d’accroitre son capital en achetant 25kg de farine de mais et 2 sacs d’avocats. Elle souhaite scolariser tous ses enfants et évoluer dans le crédit. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes parce qu’aux aujourd’hui elles sont considérées dans la société.
texts.en:
Gurhahoza is a leader of the business group Rhusezanye. Married to a farmer, she is the mother of six children. The couple can only afford tuition for two of their children. 

Gurhahoza has been selling maize and avocados for over 30 years. She conducts her sales at the public market on weekends, and as a street vendor or from her home during the week. This new loan will help to bolster her capital. She will buy 25 kg of maize flour and 2 bags of avocados. Her ambition is to send all her children to school. She would like someday to include credit to her activity. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for its support of women, who are now considered part of society.

loans.use: acheter 25kg de farine de mais et 2 sacs d’avocats.

loans.name: Ngowa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Emiliana est une brave commerçante, conseillère et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Ngowa »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants  dont 5 étudient et 2 sont mariés. La cliente est  une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec le fonds reçu  de la tontine.Son conjoint est un professionnel de la craie (Enseignant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pommes de terre, 20 kg d’arachides, 1 sac de maïs, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital afin d’augmenter le stock, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a brave trader, a counsellor and member of the business group 'Ngowa'.  This entrepreneur is 49 years old, married and has seven children.  Five of her children currently attend school, and two of them are married.  Emiliana is married to a teacher.  

She has been selling food items at a market in the local town for thirteen years, and started her business with money from a savings club.  Later she began to use the services of the field partner, Hekima.  This new loan will be used to buy one sack of potatoes, 20 kg of peanuts and a sack of maize.

As a result of this, Emiliana hopes to be able to increase her working capital, expand her stock holding, educate, clothe and feed her children.

She is very grateful to Hekima for enabling non-bankable, women entrepreneurs to become independent, especially during this post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of potatoes, 20 kg of peanuts and 1 sack of maize for resale.

loans.name: Abdalmajeed Group

texts.en:
Abdalmajeed is a group that consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB. 

Intesar is a 34-year-old married woman with five children, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is an uneducated woman. Due to the miserable living conditions of her family, she decided to help her husband improve their living standards. She started her business three years ago by purchasing some clothes and perfumes from her own money and selling them to her neighbors. Her business is going well and she has become a well-known seller in her quarter. Now, Intesar wants to improve her business, so she has applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will purchase more clothes and perfumes to meet the demand of her customers. She looks forward to improving her business through the selling of her goods and plans to target other places in the city.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Azka

texts.en:
Azka is a 23 year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is passing her life with her husband and a daughter.  Her husband is a very hard working and honest person; he conducts a small cable operating services in which he broadcasts various channels such as t.v shows, movies channels, sports channels etc.  

For the growth of business; he wants to buy a dish antenna, dvd players and cable for cabling.  Therefore, Azka has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy described accessories.  Azka  thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support given to her.

loans.use: To buy dish antenna, dvd players and cable for cabling

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 43 year old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a butcher by profession; he sells chicken in his shop.  His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell it in his shop.  Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy broilers to sell in his shop.  She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: To buy a broiler chickens to sell in the butcher shop..

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem aged, 40, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  This is her fourth loan with the BRAC Pakistan; she is an old member; she has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all of the household expenses with her poor earnings.  In fact her husband is a hawker by profession and sells all kinds of engine oils from a bicycle.  He buys the engine oils from wholesalers and sells them to workshops.  He wants to buy a large quantity of oil cans to sell, to grow his business and to overcome the poverty.  Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more quantities of engine oils.  She  is very impressed with this honorable support.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy enigne oil for reselling.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a twenty-two-year-old single man from Jericho city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Two years ago, Wisam started his own business, which is raising chickens to sell as meat in the local market. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Wisam has taken a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy feed for the chickens. By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to improve his business and also his income. Wisam will be able to start preparing for his marriage too. Wisam appears in the photo with his business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stove and some cooking tools for his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his gifts and traditional works store.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат искусная ткачиха из района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Ей 58 лет. Она живет вместе с сыном, невесткой и двумя любимыми внуками. Назокат на протяжении 22 лет занимается изготовлением атласной ткани хан. Нити, добытые из коконов шелкопряда, она обрабатывает, затем вручную раскрашивает в разные цвета, готовит шелковую основу и ткет атлас на ткацком станке. По словам Назокат работа ткача очень трудоемкая, кропотливая, требует вкуса и терпения. Однако несмотря на это ей нравится ее работа. Ведь атлас национальная гордость таджиков и платье из атласа является необходимым элементом гардероба каждой женщины-таджички. Поэтому труд Назокат всегда востребован. У нее постоянно много заказов на изготовление атласа. Сейчас чтобы выполнить очередной свой заказ, ей необходимо закупить нити. С такой целью Назокат обратилась за кредитом и очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Nazokat is a skillful weaver from the B. Gafurova region of the city of Khujand. She is 58 and lives with her son and his wife and her two beloved grandchildren. Nazokat has been making khan-atlas, a colourful regional type of satin fabric made from silk, for 22 years. She treats the threads taken from the silkworm cocoons, hand-dyes them into various colours, prepares the silk warp, or foundation of the fabric, and weaves the satin on the loom. In Nazokat's words, a weaver's work is labour-intensive and painstaking and requires good taste and patience. Despite this, however, she loves her work. After all, khan-atlas is a national pride of Tajiks and dresses made from it are a necessary element of every Tajik woman's wardrobe. Therefore, Nazokat's work is always in demand. She constantly has orders for fabric. Now, in order to fulfill the queue of orders, she needs to purchase thread. With this goal Nazokat is requesting a loan and hopes very much for support.

loans.use: to buy thread to make khan-atlas, a specialized type of silk fabric

loans.name: Joyna

texts.en: Joyna is 39 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She describes herself as honest, and operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and cereals. She has been in this business for the last year, and works in a rural area where most of her customers visit her shop regularly. She has requested a loan for Kes 10,000 to buy more maize to resell. Her goals are to be running the best business in her area within five years and raise the living standards of her family. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Rusagara Group

texts.fr:
Marcel  fait partie du groupe Rusagara  et habite à Cibitoke.Il a 48 ans est marié à Muline une cultivatrice.Il a 9 enfants âgés de 5 à 23 ans,dont 8  étudient. 


Il fait le commerce de manioc sec  depuis  10 ans. 


C’est son premier crédit à Turame.Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos (300kg)de manioc sec à revendre pour gagner plus.
 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait  construire une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marcel is a member of the Rusagara group and lives in Cibitoke. He is married to Muline, a farmer. He has 9 children between the ages of 5 and 23, 8 of whom are in school.

He has been selling dried cassava for 48 years.

This is his first loan through Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he hopes to increase his capital and buy lots of kilos (300 kg) to re-sell in order to earn more money.

In the next few years, he hopes to build a nice house and see his children in school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy more kilos (300 kg) of cassava to re-sell and earn more.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business selling nuts. Her business is located within a market area and her primary customers are her regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

Susan requested her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of ground nuts to sell. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase more ground nuts

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a twenty-four-year-old married man. He describes himself to be honest and persevering. He operates a retail business where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of resources. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruit. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of fruit

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her customers are diverse. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to have a reliable business within five years. She will invest the anticipated profits back to the business.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are milk companies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy animal feed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more onions to resell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, a professional tailor, thanks the Kiva lenders for funding her previous loan, which she paid well and on time. With the loan, Pauline's profits increased to 400,000 UGX per month, as opposed to the usual 250,000 UGX, and her business is steadily growing.

With this loan, she hopes to further increase her profits since she has won a tender for making school sweaters. She thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for enabling the progress of her business, and she pledges to keep paying well in order to get more facilities.
 
Pauline’s neighbors commented that she is a hard working and dedicated woman.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe Twiyubake et habite à Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Therence, un aide-maçon. Ensemble ils sont 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 13 ans, dont 2  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière locale depuis  15  ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière locale à revendre pour gagner plus.

Les gains de son commerce Annociate aide à satisfaire les besoins de la famille (se nourrir, se loger, se vêtir,…)
texts.en:
Annociate is a member of the Twiyubake Group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and is married to Therence, an assistant mason. Together they have four children between the ages of two and 13 years old, two of whom are studying.

She has been selling local beer for the past 32 years and is on her 16th loan with Turame. With the loan she receives from Kiva, Annociate plans to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of local beer that she will resell to earn more income. With the income she earns from her business, Annociate helps to meet the needs of her family (food, shelter, clothing...).

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of local beer that she will resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Vyagiza Group

texts.fr:
Eric fait partie du groupe Vyagiza  et   habite à Bujumbura. Il  a  26 ans et est marié  à  Aline, une couturière. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 2 ans.

Eric  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, savon,…)  depuis  2  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, savon,…)     à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait  acheter une moto pour vendre le service de transport par moto et voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en:
Eric is part of the Vyagiza Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 26 years old and married to Aline, who works as a seamstress.  Together they have a two-year-old child.

Eric has been selling various items (rice, beans, soap, etc) in his shop for two years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  The loan will increase his working capital and enable him to buy a large quantity of items for sale in his shop (rice, beans, soap, etc).  This will lead to an increase in his earnings.

In the coming years, Eric would like to buy a motorbike and start to work as a motorcycle taxi.  He would also like to see his child attend school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of items for sale in his shop (rice, beans, soap, etc).

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is the age of 29, living with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a turner by profession. He repairs and renews the damage to spare parts of vehicles. He has been doing this business for many years. His shop is situated near a workshop. He wants to buy scrap spare parts of vehicles at low prices then resell them to the workshop at a high price. 

He does not have enough cash in hand to buy scrap spare parts. Therefore, Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy vehicles' spare parts.

Sumaira gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap spare parts of vehicles for her husband to repair and sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 39. She is the mother of four children. 

Her husband owns an electrician's shop in which he sells electrical goods. He also provides services for repairing electric water motors and pumps. He binds the motors of washing machines, water pumps, and ceiling fans. For this purpose, he requires a lot of copper cable coils which are so expensive and beyond his purchasing limit.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empowered to buy copper coils to carry on his services. In addition, he wants to buy some extra electric switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets, etc.

This is Parveen's first loan. She shared her wish to take a larger loan, after this loan.

loans.use: to buy copper wires and coils, so her husband can repair electric motors.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 36-year-old religious woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children, and her husband, who is their sole means of support, also supports his parents and sibling. He makes a living by running a store where he sells motorbikes on the installment plan. He currently lacks enough inventory to have a successful business, because he doesn't have enough capital to buy more bikes to sell. Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so that he can buy more inventory. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy motorbikes to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 31 years old, and living with her husband.  Her husband is a catering services provider for ceremonies; he provides the decoration lights, wedding tents on weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business, because it is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is going to peak, but most of his tents have become clumsy due to lack of usage for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents and some additional crockery, to provide the better services to his customers. 

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy new tents, crockery, and decoration lights to provide the catering services.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tents, decoration lights, and crockery for catering services.

loans.name: El Milagro De Santa Ana Group

texts.en:
The ten women of this group from Santa Ana, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala successfully finished their first nine-month business cycle.  The original ten women of this group started working with Namaste in 2013.  During this cycle they had classes in handling their money, and also advice from a business advisor in developing and implementing a business plan.  In addition to teaching them how to keep their income and expenses in a notebook, their classes helped them learn to manage their money. One of the tricks they learned for handling their cash savings was to keep the money in a narrow necked bleach bottle. That simple idea made it easier to put the cash in than to take it out and helped them increase their savings. 
Out of the original group five women have chosen to go on working with Namaste for a second business cycle.  All five of these group members have businesses related to the sale of food items. 
Ana Maria (second from left) is an outstanding member of this continuing group.  She is sixty years old with a primary school education.  She is head of a household that includes an adult daughter and a four year-old grandchild.   Her business is selling tortillas and also selling items from a catalog. During the first cycle she successfully applied what she learned in the business classes and from the advice of her business advisor. She paid back her loan and her profits rose from 1364 Guatemalan Quetzales per month at the beginning of the cycle to 2120 Guatemalan Quetzales at the end of the nine-month cycle, an increase of 55%. 
Her goal for the next nine-months is to diversify her inventory without compromising the success of her original business selling handmade tortillas.  She is also planning to increase her tortilla sales. To help her in this Ana Maria is looking forward to the additional classes and business advice she will receive during this next cycle.

loans.use: to diversify her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build Victorio´s house by promoting and strengthening his community development through mutual help.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 19 year old single mother of one who sells second hand clothes for a living. She has been operating this venture since 2013. Upon leaving school in 2011, Eunice went into a marriage that broke down soon after her child was born. She was left alone to fend for herself and her child, when the husband went to venture into gold panning for a living. From the business Eunice is able to provide for her two year old child and pay for her rentals. The business is promising and there is demand for the clothes as people in Zimbabwe are looking to alternatives to expensive and cheap quality imports. Eunice would like to use this loan to purchase more bales of the clothes she sells, if she can buy at least two per month she can increase her revenue faster. Her goals are to increase her stock levels as well as getting licensing to sell from a shop and not from the streets like she is currently doing.  PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their goods.

loans.use: to purchase more stock (bales of second hand clothes)

loans.name: Ruramai

texts.en: Ruramai is a 28 year old mother of two who is running a taxi business. Currently she has one car that services a route in town and is helping provide income for her family.  She has been operating this taxi since 2012. Since the car is the only source of income it operates for long hours per day on the bad roads in Harare. Due to this fact the car needs changing of shocks and tyres more frequently than would be done under normal circumstances. For the taxi business to continue smoothly servicing of the car has to be more frequent too. Ruramai would like to use this loan to purchase spares as well as have the car undergo a major servicing. Her goals are to increase her fleet of cars and she is working on saving towards buying a second car by the end of the year. PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their goods.

loans.use: to purchase spares and repair her taxi

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda is a 21 year old single mother of one who sells second hand clothes for a living. She has been operating this venture since 2013. From the business Emelda is able to provide for her four year old child and pay for her rentals. The business is promising and there is demand for the clothes as people in Zimbabwe are looking to alternatives to expensive and cheap quality imports. She is now saving money so that her son can start school in 2015. Emelda would like to use this loan to purchase more bales of the clothes she sells, if she can buy at least two per month she can increase her revenue faster. Her goals are to increase her stock levels as well as getting licensing to sell from a shop and not from the streets like she is currently doing.  PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their goods.

loans.use: purchase stock of bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Suheel

texts.en:
Suheel is a 26-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Suheel's brother works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Suheel is a student at a local university, where he studies social service. He would like to finish his study and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Suheel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Suheel will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. 

Suheel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a professional computer for graphic design work.

loans.name: Abdel Kareem

texts.en: Abdel Kareem is a 21-year-old, single young man, from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Abdel opened a small cafe one year ago in his village. He sells light sandwiches and soft drinks. It is a very successful project since the youth like to go there.  Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his cafe by adding a new coffee machine and other tools for his work. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to improve his cafe and increase its productivity.  Abdel appears in the photo in his café.

loans.use: to improve his cafe by adding a new coffee machine and other tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his chicken coop and buy some medicine for his flock of poultry.

loans.name: Millie

texts.en:
Millie is 30 years old and has three children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a cyber cafe where she offers internet browsing, photocopying, and printing services, which she has been doing for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular customers. 

Millie requested her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a laptop. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes to raise the standard of living of her family in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Elika

texts.en: Elika is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions and cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of maize. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to put up a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize.

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en: Zachariah is 36 years old, married and the father of two children who are 5 and 12 years old. For the last two years, he has earned a living by operating a retail business where he sells water. Most of his customers live in his community, and his biggest business challenge to an irregular water supply. He has requested a loan for Kes 20,000 to buy a water pump which will allow him to serve his customers better. His goal is to expand his business within the next five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to save money and buy a van for business. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water pump.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla has been raising pigs for more than seven years, earning well to provide for the family. Her income was good and from her generated revenue, her previous loan used for feed and pigs was successfully repaid. Priscilla became an active member and her ability to engage in her business has improved. To boost her pig raising, she took a new loan to buy feed. She was determined enough to expand her business, to ensure better income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as enthusiastic and determined. 

She operates a farm to keep cows and grow crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming and her primary customers are maize millers and other farmers. Her biggest business challenge is a poor road system. 

She will use 30,000 KES to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old married woman with 7 children between the years of 12 and 30. She describes herself as determined and self reliant. 

She operates a farm to grow maize and tea. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest business challenge is the lack of adequate capital. She will use 20,000 KES to buy farm supplies. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 59-year-old married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as visionary and focused. 

She operates a retail business to sell cereal. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate capital. She will use 20,000 KES to restock cereal. 

Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to restock cereal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 46-year-old woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm to grow tea. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located on fertile land which is good for farming and her primary customers are large scale buyers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather conditions. 

She will use 10,000 KES to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 10,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 30-year-old woman with 2 children who are 10 and 14 years old. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a carpentry business to make furniture. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for carpentry work and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of materials. She will use 20,000 KES to buy more materials. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more materials for use in the carpentry business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 34-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as focused and visionary. 

She operates a farm to grow tea and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a productive and fertile area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations and bad weather. She will use 15,000 KES to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs. 

Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells charcoal for additional income. 
 
Julie would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 50,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julie hopes that her business continues to flourish and she dreams to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Umushitsi Group

texts.fr:
Diane fait partie du groupe Umushitsi  et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 29  ans et est mariée à  Léonce, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, âgés  de  4 à 7 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis  2  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  acheter une maison, une voiture  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Diane is part of the Umushitsi Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 29 years old and is married to Léonce, a shopkeeper. They have two children together, aged four and seven, one of whom attends school.

Diane has been selling clothes for two years. This is her first loan from Turame. With her Kiva loan, Diane is going to increase her capital and purchase many items of clothing to sell in order to earn more.

In the years to come, Diane would like to buy a house, a car, and see her children go to school.

loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase many items of clothing to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 7 and 11 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. Susan has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use 20,000 KES to buy salon equipment to enable her to efficiently serve her customers. 

Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Nevaditas De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE SENKATA” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maricela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, venta de CD´s, salón de belleza, venta de sábanas, venta de chalecos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maricela es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa al observar que los productos que tiene son comerciales en las ferias.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The “NEVADITAS DE SENKATA communal bank has started their 9th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Maricela as the President. The members businesses are varied, amongst them are: the sale of underwear, selling CDs, a beauty salon, selling sheets and the sale of vests.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Maricela included.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer 7 years ago on the invitation of her mother who is a member of the institution. Her business is selling clothing. She learned about this business observing the products that were being sold in the markets. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (buying clothing wholesale) which she will buy in the markets of the city of Oruro and later sell in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she lives with her common-law partner and has a child. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she enjoys the loans that the institute's personnel offer.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 45-year-old married man with 10 children between the ages of  4 and 22. He describes himself as persistent. 

He operates a transport business to transport customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as fluctuating prices. He will use 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standards of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a retail business to sell charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use 20,000 KES to restock charcoal. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to restock charcoal.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy different accessories and products needed in her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their family. She also sells fruit shakes for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy different accessories and personal products needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different accessories and personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa previously borrowed 50,000 PHP, which she used to buy gardening materials such as wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Hermosa is requesting another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will uses to buy gardening materials such as wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will help her sustain her daily needs. Hermosa dreams to have different branches in Cavite and hopes that her family is always in good condition. 

Hermosa meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from God. .

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchaser gardening materials such as wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Turuhuke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Michel fait partie du groupe Turuhuke et   habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 50 ans et est marié à  Espérance,
 une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés  de 3 à 11 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des tuyaux, lavabo,…   depuis 15  ans. 

Il  est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  tuyaux, de lavabos,...  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait construire une maison, acheter un véhicule  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Michel is part of the Turuhuke Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 50 years old and is married to Espérance, a shopkeeper. They have seven children together, aged three to 11, four of whom attend school.

Michel has been selling pipes and sinks for 15 years. He is on his fourth loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan, Michel is going to increase his capital and purchase many pipes and sinks to sell in order to earn more.

In the future, he would like to build a house, purchase a vehicle, and see his children go to school.

loans.use: To increase his capital and purchase many pipes and sinks to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru:
Зиёда жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 33 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом кишлаке. У Зиёды после окончания школы так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Зиёду выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома, она никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Зиёда вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Они выращивают скот, затем продают полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Зиёда получает хороший доход. Муж Зиёды также помогает ей вести этот бизнес, он выполняет более трудные задания. Их дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Зиёда с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Зиёда заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Ziyoda is a cheerful and hardworking 33-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small village. After Ziyoda graduated from secondary school, circumstances happened such that she was unable to receive a higher education due to financial difficulties in her family. Right after graduating from secondary school, Ziyoda got married and became a homemaker. However, even though she is always at home, she is never without something to do. She and her husband strive to do all that they can to provide their children with all of the necessities.

In order to have a steady income to live on, Ziyoda and her husband started their own business. They practice livestock breeding. They raise cattle, then sell the milk and meat that they get from them. Ziyoda receives a good income from this business. Ziyoda's husband also helps her run this business. He does the more labor-intensive tasks. Their income is enough for an average standard of living. But now, they do not have enough money to cover all of their present needs. Currently, Ziyoda and her husband want to buy more cattle to fatten them up. This is why she is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Ziyoda thanks Arvand in advance for their support and really relies on a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Unión Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN ESTRELLA” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de tuta y chuño, tejido de polainas, venta de papa, venta de humintas, sastrería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio taller de sastrería y venta de telas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió conjuntamente su esposo hace cinco años, desde esa fecha trabajan en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializara a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The “UNIÓN ESTRELLA” communal bank is starting their 6th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of 8 members lead by a board of directors where María is the treasurer. The businesses of the members are varied. Amongst them are a sewing workshop, selling dried potatoes, knitting leggings, selling potatoes, selling humintas (a pre-Hispanic corn based food) and sewing. 

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, María being one of them. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a member of the institution who visited her in her home. She has a dress making shop and sells fabric. She learned this trade along with her husband about 5 years ago and since then has been working in this business. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (buying fabric wholesale) that she will acquire in the city of Oruro and later sell to her customers on request. This form of work allows her to generate the resources she needs to support her family as she is married and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the loans that the institution's personnel provide.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Hilda Gay

texts.en: Hilda Gay's mother is a teacher and her father works as security guard to make a living. She has two siblings still depending on her parents. She studies for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management in a university. With her passion of serving people through cooking, she likes this course the most. She wants to become a role model to her siblings, and she wants to let them know the importance of education in improving lives. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay the school tuition fees. She wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon  is 57 years old and married. She has a tailoring business repairing items and making made-to-order curtains and pillow cases with the help of her husband. She sells assorted homemade cloths to generate additional income. She had a lot of designs and ideas that make her finished products fast-selling.  

Corazon requested a loan, which she will use to buy fabrics and thread. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself as focused and honest. 

She operates a farm to grow peas, carrots and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough farm supplies to increase production. She will use 20,000 KES to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. 

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 22-year-old married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a bakery to make mandazi (East African donuts) . She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. She will use the 20,000 KES to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for  mandazi . 

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients to preparing mandazi.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 59 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a piggery in her backyard, while her husband does a buy-and-sell business for a living. Virgilia has thirty years experience in this field. She is working every day in order to provide income for the family. 

Virgilia requested this loan to buy additional piglets. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so she may expand the piggery and continue assisting her family with the additional income.
 
She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

The story of Virgilia and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Unificada Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de objetos de plástico, atención de parqueo, venta de pipocas, salón de peinados, producción de mantillas, carnicería, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lavado y venta de arena; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, quien tiene el mismo negocio, con un capital acumulado decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de palas, picos, cernidores) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención que ofrece el personal de la institución.

En la imagen falta una compañera, que se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “UNIFICADA II” will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of 8 members and is led by a Board of Directors where Lucia is the Treasurer.  The members of this communal bank engage in different businesses such as neighbourhood store, selling plastic objects, valet, popcorn vendor, hair salon, blanket maker, butcher, and food seller.    

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Lucia is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from a member who visited her at her house. 

Currently she has a business of washing and selling sand. She gained knowledge about this business from her husband who has the same business. With the accumulated capital she decided to start a business independently.

The loan she will now receive is to increase capital (purchase of shovels, picks, and sieves) that she will get from distribution stores in the city of El Alto and later she will sell it in her place of business. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the attention that the institution provides.

One member is missing from the photo because she was at the doctor’s office.

loans.use: to purchase purchase of shovels, picks, and sieves.

loans.name: 02.01.3 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hương has a retail business selling dry food and she is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell .

Hương is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She is the group leader of the 02.01.3 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.  Thoa lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam.  In 2006, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for 7 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally lives with the family of her husband and one little child in Bakan district, Pursat Province, Cambodia.  She is a 23-year-old married woman and a local farmer who is engaged in farming rice.  She has been in this field for more than 6 years and earns a suitable income for the family.  Farming is the sole source of her family’s income.
