At this time, Phally has applied for a 1,000 USD loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phally is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old married woman with 5 children. She describes herself as generous and kind. 

She operates a retail shop to sell salt, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use 20,000 KES to buy restock sugar, salt, cooking fat and other items. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She also raises poultry to earn extra income.

loans.use: to restock sugar, salt, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
This is Estella, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Hernanie, a rolling store vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estella operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Estella dreams to expand and have other stalls. She hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Berlinda

texts.en:
This is Ma. Berlinda.  She is 38 years old, and resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romerico, a worker abroad, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Berlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Ma. Berlinda dreams to have a grocery store and hopes to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Bahati is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, vegetables, maize flour, and sugar for her food stall. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, vegetables, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 28-year-old single man. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business to sell clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES to restock his clothing inventory. His business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to  buy restock clothing inventory.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is 39 years old, married, and has children. She has a farm where she grows and harvest flowers with the support of her husband. The couple also grows coconut and bananas in their farm, their main source of income. Susan has many years experience in this field. She works every day in order to help her husband earn income for the family 

Susan requested a loan, which she will use to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides. She is aiming to develop her farm and increase her profits to support her children's future needs in school. The couple wants to give their children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JULIO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ortencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de tucumanas, venta de comida, venta de papa y chuño, ayudante de minibús, venta de repuestos de cocina, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ortencia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien tiene el mismo negocio, con un capital acumulado decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras, abarrotes) que adquirirá de las ferias distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece el personal de la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una socia, por que fue a consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “25 DE JULIO” (July 25th) will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of 9 members and is led by a Board of Directors where Ortencia is the President.  The members of this communal bank engage in different businesses such as blanket making, selling tucumanas (a type of empanada-- a meat-filled pastry), selling food, selling potatoes and freeze-dried potato, minibus assistant, selling spare parts for the kitchen, and transportation service.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Ortencia is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from a member who visited her at her house. Currently she has a business selling food. She gained knowledge about this business from her mother who has the same business. With the accumulated capital she decided to start a business independently.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to increase capital, purchasing vegetables and groceries, which will be purchased from fair distributors in the city of El Alto and later she will make food and sell it. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training that the institution provides.

One member is missing in the photo because she was at the doctor's office.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.en:
Rasel has run her grocery business for more than eleven years to make a living. She sells a variety of goods which help her earn more income. Rasel’s business experience is not enough to shield her from business ups and downs, but she is very determined to support her children and work hard to earn more. 

Rasel is requesting a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business and provide good shopping for her costumers. In the future, Rasel wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en: Ferlie, a mother  of three,  provides  transportation services in their village to make a living. For more than two years, she has earned well to provide for the family.  She needs repairs and maintenance for their motorcycle to improve the services to the costumers. Her husband is the one who operates their motorcycle in order to earn more returns than rental, because they want to save money to give their children a better education. She will use the micro finance loan of GDMPC to cover motor repairs and maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to acquire a new unit of motorcycle to use for expansion of their business.

loans.use: to cover motor repairs and maintenance costs.

loans.name: 01.11.1 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Vân is 31 years old and is married with a child. She lives with her family in Thanh Hoa city, a town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall where she sells bread. Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two previous loans. Her greatest business hardship is her lack of capital. Vân is the leader of the 01.11.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

Vân is requesting a loan to buy bread to sell. In the future, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase bread sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 50-year-old mother, who was gifted with four children. Due to hardships of living, she aims to improve her small variety store and help her husband in financing the education of her children. She plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more stocks of frozen foods, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, canned goods, and medicines to sell in her store. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, canned goods, and medicines to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She operates a billiard pool business as well as a variety store and tricycle business. Alicia was able to use her previous loan to supply the needs of her businesses. Her business income helps her to provide for her household’s everyday expenditures. Alicia’s husband is very supportive of her and they both work hard to provide for their family.

Alicia is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy supplies and provide operational needs for her billiard pool business. She will also use the loan to maintain her tricycle and buy grocery items for her variety store. Alicia’s business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will last longer and she hopes to have a good life. Alicia meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her billiard pool business.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 37 лет.  Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.  У него многодетная семья. Некоторые дети ходят в школу, а некоторые совсем маленькие и нуждаются в хорошем уходе. Жена Дтльшод нигде не работает, она сидит дома и ухаживает за своими детьми. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание и проживание Дильшод занимается собственным бизнесом. 

Дильшод занимается  торговлей принадлежностей для телефонов и некоторые телефоны. За свою деятельность он успел изучить все тонкости своего дела. Он закупает принадлежности для телефона на большом оптовом базаре и привозит их в свой посёлок. Для этого у него имеется собственный ларёк. Также Дильшод имеет уже постоянных клиентов, которые точно знают, что у него они могут найти хороший качественный товар. Сейчас Дильшод желает расширить ассортимент своего товара и для этого он нуждается в финансах. Поэтому Дильшод обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить партию принадлежностей для телефонов. Он очень надеется и ожидает помощи и поддержки от Арванд и Кива, и заранее благодарит за оказанную поддержку.
texts.en: Dilshod is a positive and hardworking 37 year-old man.  He is married and has five children.  He has a large family.  Some of his children attend a school, and others are really young and need good care.  Dilshod's wife is not employed; she stays at home and takes care of the children.  Dilshod is involved in his own business in order to have a consistent income for food and living expenses.  Dilshod is involved in selling accessories for phones and also sells some phones.  He was able to learn all of the nuances of his business during his tenure there.  He buys phone accessories at a large wholesale market and brings them to his village.  He has his own kiosk for this.  Dilshod also has regular customers, who know exactly that they will find good, quality merchandise from him.  Now Dilshod wants to expand his merchandise selection and needs financing for this.  This is why Dilshod came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy an inventory of phone accessories.  He hopes for and awaits the help and support from Arvand and Kiva and is grateful in advance for the provided support.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: 01.10.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Nam is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is group leader of the 01.10.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She has a retail business selling clothes, which she has been doing for three years. The main hardship that Nam faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Nam requested a loan, which she will use to purchase clothes to sell.  In 2014, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Om-Iman Group

texts.en:
Om-Iman is a group consisting of five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Latifa is a 43-years-old mother with two children who live in a small house. She is the leader of the group.  Her husband passed away several years ago and she depends entirely on her husband's very low retirement pension.  She is illiterate. She hopes that once her children finish their education, they will be able to help her.  

Latifa wants to improve her house and purchase some furniture. She feels shy when others look at her unorganized kitchen. She plans to buy a kitchen cabinet to organize her kitchen, but she can't afford that.   She applied for 50,000 YER from AMB.  She looks forward to providing her family with better living conditions and opening a savings account to accumulate money for her son in the future.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen cabinet .

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru:
Мухтарам трудолюбивая и позитивная женщина в возрасте 45 лет.  Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй  Мухтарам живёт в небольшом сельском посёлке. Муж вместе с сыном находятся в России на заработках. А Мухтарам с другими детьми занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь стабильный доход на проживание.

Мухтарам очень трудолюбивая женщина, она очень любит свою семью и старается чтобы её дети ни в чём не нуждались. Мухтарам занимается животноводством.  Она сотрудничает с Арванд с 2012 года и является ответственным клиентом. Первый свой кредит она получила на покупку первого скота для откармливания. Сейчас она имеет несколько голов скота, но скоро она будет их уже продавать. И чтобы её бизнес не остановился она хочет сейчас закупить ещё несколько голов скота для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса. Но сейчас у Мухтарам нету достаточной суммы денег для покупки скота. Поэтому она обратилась в очередной раз в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за предоставляемую поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhtaram is a hardworking and positive 45-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Muhtaram lives with her family in a small country village. Her husband and son work abroad in Russia. Muhtaram and her other children have their own business to make a steady income to live on.

Muhtaram is a very hardworking woman. She really loves her family and does all that she can so that her children want for nothing. Muhtaram practices livestock breeding. She has worked with Arvand since 2012 and is a responsible customer of their services. She received her first loan to buy her first cow for fattening up. Now she has several cattle but she will be selling them soon. In order to keep her business going, she now wants to buy even more cattle for the further development of her business. But she does not currently have enough money to buy cattle. This is why she is requesting a loan from Arvand yet again to buy cattle. She thanks Arvand in advance for the provided support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: 03.08.11 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lưu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Lưu is 53 years old, and married with three children. Lưu supports one dependent; two other children are grown up. She is the group leader of the 03.08.11 - Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. Her business is in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2011, Lưu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lưu has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Lưu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lưu hopes to travel for vacation within the country, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Al-Hajeri Group

texts.en:
AL-Hajeri is a group consisting of six women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.


Hajer is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Hajer is an uneducated woman and works hard. She wants to help her husband cover the family's expanses, so she has been working as a hairdresser for four years. She also rents wedding dresses. Hajer makes modest profits, but she found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy new wedding dresses because most of profits she earns go to her family expenses.  Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. 

Hajer looks forward to opening a beauty salon in her quarter.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to rent them to costumers.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
This is 44 year old Yusuf.  He is married and has 4 children aged 13, 7, 6, and 8 months. 

In 2009, Yusuf established his food stuff, seasonings, maggi, and salt business. He began his business because he was trained as a business man. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like to borrow 3,000,000 SLL . Yusuf requires a loan in order to buy more Maggie Seasoning and salt to sell. 

In the future, Yusuf plans to expand his business  and to also see his children educated at the university level. He is very hard working   

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more Maggie Seasoning and salt for resale.

loans.name: 03.08.12 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Chung is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Chung is the group leader of the 03.08.12 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of seven members.  Chung works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Her main hardship is the lack of capital.
 
Chung is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2012, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Virginia supported her husband in generating income to satisfy their necessities and finance the schooling of their three children. 

Due to high cost of school fees, she supported her husband in operating their jeepney, hired by the passengers, to generate additional income. 

To continuously use their jeepney, Virginia is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of their jeepney. 

She hopes that her loan request will be granted, so they are able to continue using their jeepney and provide safe transportation to their passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of their jeepney

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Originally from Baray district of Kampong Thom province, Kit is 35 years old, married, and has one child. To better feed her family, Kit works as a gardener, and together with her family, she is engaged in farming and agriculture. She is able to earn well for her family.

Kit has never been with any local state banks or MFIs before. She is requesting a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited, which she will use to buy a used motorbike for her family's transportation needs. With the motorbike, she can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service while commuting to work or going to their desired directions. In the future, she is aiming to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike for her transportation needs.

loans.name: 03.03.17 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Cúc is 31 years old, and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.03.17 - Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. Cúc lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cúc has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Cúc hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Wuyah

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Wuyah.  She is married and has 3 children who are 13,10, and 7 years old. 

In 2009, Wuyah established a business to sell plastic slippers. She began her business because she was not too educated. She works 7 days a week and 11 hours a day to  earn about 720,000 SLL every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy different kinds of plastic slippers to sell.  

In the future, Wuyah plans to educate her children at the university level.  She was able to pay her children's school fees and also earn  income. 

Wuyah is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic slippers.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and a mother of three. She operates a small variety store but has inadequate capital. Despite the hardship of living, Margie and her husband aim to improve their income in order to satisfy their family’s necessities and educate their children. 

Margie is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of vegetables, rice, grocery items, and soft drinks to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for improving her store. Margie hopes that someday her family will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, grocery items and soft drinks  to sell

loans.name: 03.03.16 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thúy is 33 years old and is married with two children. They live in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Thúy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thúy is the leader of her group, which consists of three members. In 2011, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a farmer who lives in Sann Jose. This area grows a lot of crops. She loves to farm and grow crops. This has been her business for seven years; her primary source of income is selling pigs. She also has a retail business. 

Her biggest challenge in raising pigs is there are not enough laborers. 

She said that this loan will enable her to purchase feed and vitamins. 

As a result of this loan, Janette will be able to earn more income and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 55 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking person who supports her family. 

She loves to cook, which is why she started a food business. Leticia is asking for a loan of Php 27,000 to buy ingredients like onions, garlic, meat, chicken, cooking oil and salt for her business.

She hopes in the future that her business expands so she can give her family the best quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like onions, garlic, meat, chicken, cooking oil and salt for her business.

loans.name: Chokola Group

texts.fr: La cliente Balihamwabo est vice-présidente de l’association de crédit Chokola.  Agée de 51 ans, elle est  mère de 13 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Mariée à un homme sans emploie,  elle est vendeuse des poissons (poisson sales, fretins fumés). Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter ½ sacs de fretins fumés et 20 pièces de poisons salés. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et étendre son projet de commerce. Enfin, elle remercie fortement Hekima.
texts.en: The client Balihamwabo is the vice president of the credit association Chokola. 51 years old, she is the mother of 13 children who are all in school. Her husband is unemployed and she sells fish (small smoked fish and salted fish). She is requesting this new loan to buy half a bag of small smoked fish and 20 pieces of salted fish. She would like educate her children and expand her business. Finally, she would like to greatly thank Hekima.

video.title: Kiva Borrower nshobole from The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.use: to buy half a bag of small smoked fish and 20 pieces of salted fish.

loans.name: Rabia' Al-Shohada'a Group

texts.en:
Rabia' Al-Shohada'a group consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Nada is a 26-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. 

She is a university graduate who couldn't find a job in her field of study. Nada didn’t give up and started a business with her mother two years ago. She sells women and children's clothes door-to-door. After she learned how to run this business well, she started to run her business by herself. 

Currently, she wants to buy new stylish clothes to seize the opportunity of the beginning of marriage season when women and children wish to buy new clothes , but she doesn’t have enough capital.  She decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more clothes. 

She looks forward to improving her business  to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy new stylish clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children. One of her sons is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this reason, Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her son wants to fix his rickshaw and wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. Sughran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to maintain her son's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Abeza Group

texts.fr:
Degaul  fait partie du groupe Abeza  et   habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 38 ans et est marié à  Francine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés  de 10 à  22 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de restaurant (haricot, riz, pomme de terre,…) depuis 7  ans. 

Il  est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, de pomme de terre,…à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait implanter des  restaurants dans d’autres coins de Bujumbura   et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Degaul is part of the Abeza Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and is married to Francine, a shopkeeper. They have five children together, aged 10 to 22, and all of them attend school.

Degaul has been cooking and selling food (beans, rice, potatoes) for seven years. He is on his sixth Turame loan. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, beans, and potatoes to sell in his restaurant in order to earn more.

In the future, Degaul would like to open restaurants in other areas of Bujumbura and see his children go to school.

loans.use: To increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, beans, and potatoes to sell (cooked) in his restaurant in order to earn more.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is attending school, while the other is still very young. For the past 14 years, Un has been involved in the farming business, which is the important source of income for his family. With his farming practice experience, he has now successfully developed his farm.

These will be his first loans with Hattha Kaksekar Limited and Kiva. Un would like to use it for the purchase of a solar home system to install on the roof top of his house, which is located in an off-grid area of the province. 

After this initial investment, Un will be able to gain access to clean energy, which he will use to support household appliances such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in his family can even work or study at night. 

He is very thankful, and is hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to install on the roof top of his house.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
Arcadio, a single entrepreneur, provides transportation services in his village. For more than two years, he has earned well enough to provide for his needs. He also sets aside money to support his parents' needs. 

He needs to maintain his motorcycle to improve service to his costumers. With a micro-finance loan from GDMPC, he will have money to use for maintenance costs. He plans on saving some income for future needs. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance costs of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Illumenada

texts.en:
Illumenada owned a transportation business in their village to make a living. Her husband is the one who operates the business, and her previous loan was used for spare parts and accessories; it was repaid successfully. For more than four years in running this, she saved money for their house improvements, like buying some appliances. 

Aside from this, the couple also had a farm, their main source of income. She planned to cultivate the vacant farm to earn an income from this. 

To purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit.

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Angeli previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, personal household, and business expenditures. She also has a bakery for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell results in better profit. She will also use the loan in her bakery. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angeli hopes that her business continues to flourish and dreams of having their own house and car. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maha Group

texts.en:
Maha is a group consisting of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Zubydah is a 28-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse in Hodeidah, Yemen.  She is the leader of the group. 

Zubydah studied till the Preliminary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because of her family's economic situation. Due to the miserable condition of her family, she decided to help her husband to improve their living standards. 

Zubydah started a business to sell accessories, perfume, and other goods.  She started a door-to-door business six years ago. She makes a modest profit, but due to her small capital, she is unable to meet the high daily demands of her clients.  Therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to purchase different ingredients to make incense. 

Zubydah  looks forward to expanding her business by opening a large store for incense and then exporting her goods.

loans.use: to purchase different ingredients to make incense.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed, and the Dewi Fortuna group was able to pay off the loan on time. In the journey of its business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way, so that they get a satisfactory result. 

Entering their eighth loan, most of the members of Dewi Fortuna group have three or four local pigs for pig barbeques. The local pigs will sell every two months.

As the head of the group, Jero Pudak became a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs. 

She has a sow, and it will give birth soon; she prepares for the piglets. She will sell the piglets for fattening. She’s really happy, and thankful to Kiva, MUK and the lenders for supporting her business and also the group. 

Now she can support her husband’s income to fullfill their daily needs. Her husband works as a brick maker.

One of the member can’t attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 55-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her children like her a lot due to her caring nature. Suriya has owned a dairy farm at her home since 1995. She produces milk with the help of her husband and sons. She is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform her tasks as she used to do when she was younger. 

A few days ago one of her cattle was stolen due to lack of security and because there is no proper shelter for her cattle. This needs to be improved. She wants to buy a buffalo and maintain a cowshed but she has insufficient savings. Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that she can overcome these deficiencies and carry on her business smoothly. 

From the profit amount, Suriya will ensure the security for her cattle and build a shelter to avoid theft in the future. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and  BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for the production of milk to sell.

loans.name: Sreyhouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreyhouch is 30 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and supplementing the family’s income by working as a tailor. She earns about 40,000 KHR a day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sreyhouch requested a loan from VIsionFund for her group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Dusanure Group

texts.fr:
Josélyne fait partie du groupe Dusanure  et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a   37 ans et est mariée à  Denis, un soudeur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés  de  4 à 9 ans, dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de riz   depuis  12  ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz (10 sacs)   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation de pagnes, de chaussures en provenance de Dubaï.
texts.en:
Josélyne is part of the group Dusanure and lives in Bujumbura. She is 37 years old and married to Denis, a welder. Together they have three children, from 4 to 9 years old, of whom two are students. 

Josélyne has been doing commerce in rice for twelve years. 

She is on her tenth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice (10 sacks) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to do commerce importing 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and shoes from Dubai.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has been selling  fish in her community. For many years, she earned enough that her previous loan used for this business was successfully repaid. 

With her generated income and the support of her husband, Julieta was able to start buying scrap. She earns a better income from this business.  

She's been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2005. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more scrap and junk to resell. She wants to use her generated revenue as additional capital in order to improve her business and to have more income for the family's future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap and junk to resell.

loans.name: Zamirbek

texts.ru: Замирбек 36 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Замирбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замирбек занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замирбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 1 теленок, 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,83 ГА, на котором выращивает арбузы, огурцы, овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замирбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - для закупа высококачественных семян арбузов, огурцов и овощей для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Замирбек намерен получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Замирбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку грузовой автомашины.
texts.en: Zamirbek is 36 years old, married, and together with his wife, is raising three children. Zamirbek has a secondary education. As the main source of income for his family, Zamirbek practices livestock breeding and crop farming. He started this business 14 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamibek's hard work, he currently has 6 milk cows, 1 calf and 5 sheep on his farm, as well as a 1.83 hectare plot of land on which he grows watermelons, cucumbers and vegetables. His monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Zamirbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan to buy high quality watermelon, cucumber and vegetable seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Zamirbek is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase his family's capital. Zamirbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. He also intends to save money to buy a cargo truck.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, watermelon and vegetable seeds, as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 20 лет, живет с матерью, сестрой и братом в районе Хуросон. В возрасте 16 лет она начала семейный торговый бизнес. Фируза на протяжении 4 лет на местном рынке своего района занимается продажей салатов собственного производства. Она дома вместе с матерью и сестрой готовит разнообразный ассортимент маринованных овощных салатов и затем выводит их на рынок на продажу. Фируза имеет своих постоянных клиентов, которые не могут обойтись без ее вкусных салатов. Фирузе в свою очередь нравится как ее покупатели получают наслаждение от употребления ее салатов. В данный момент Фируза просит кредит, чтобы купить партию овощей и специй для приготовления своих маринованных салатов на продажу. Этот кредит ей очень важен для продолжения и расширения своего семейного бизнеса.
texts.en: Firuza is a young, unmarried 20-year-old girl. She lives with her mother, sister and brother in the Khuroson District. At the age of 16, she started her own family retail business. Over the past 4 years, Firuza has sold salads she makes herself at the local market in her district. Together with her mother and sister, she makes a variety of marinated vegetable salads and then brings them to the market for sale. Firuza has her own loyal customers who cannot get by without her delicious salads. Firuza, in turn, likes how her customers get enjoyment from eating her salads. Firuza is currently requesting a loan to buy a batch of vegetables and spices to make her marinated salads to sell. This loan is very important to her, as it will allow her to continue and expand her family business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices to prepare salads for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Meet Emily, who does farming and resides with her husband and six children all of whom are school aged. She has been doing farming for over 10 years with her primary income source being from the sale of milk, eggs, maize, and vegetables.

Emily says that she needed funds to purchase more poultry and that is why she chose Juhudi Kilimo because they are interested in the livelihood of clients. During the training offered by the loan officers, she learned how not to divert fund use. This loan will benefit her because she will be able to collect animal dung for use as farm manure. This will improve her farm productivity and hence improve her income and their living standards will get better.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31-year-old farmer living in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and one child.  He has been doing farming for 15 years.  His income comes from the sale of tea, maize, bananas, cabbages, eggs and milk.  Besides farming, he has a motorbike which he uses to offer transportation to the residents in the area.  His biggest challenge in farming is the lack of sufficient funds and poor markets.

Paul chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer secure loans to their farmers at low interest rates.  This loan will help Paul develop his horticultural farming by buying more seed for planting, and get more income and thus, improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more seed for his horticulture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy blankets and suits to sell

loans.name: Kitala School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joseph. He is the head teacher of Kitala Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kisubi in Wakiso with 1,200 students. Kitala Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultrafiltration water treatment system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an ultrafiltration water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kitala will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Joseph ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil and fish for her business.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: This is 43 year old Viola from Harare the capital of Zimbabwe which means 'he who does not sleep". She is married with three children and two of them are attending school.  Viola runs a retail business selling men's wear,ladies wear and electrials. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of liquidity to enhance business. Viola has requested a loan of $1000 to buy blankets, ladies wear and men's wear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her family income to improve thus enabling client to meet household expenses. In the future Viola plans to own her premises.

loans.use: to buy blankets, ladies' wear and menswear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi is married and the father of a child. They are living in the Abseron region. His wife is a housewife and doesn’t work at an incoming business. His child is 13 years old and is in the sixth class in secondary school. Tagi has been a taxi driver for eight years. Tagi adores his family and to support them, he work hard. Today he needs a loan of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car’s salon (interior). Therefore, he has applied to Komak company for a loan. Tagi  thanks Kiva and all the lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to change the wheels of the car.

loans.use: to repair his car’s salon (interior)

loans.name: Tobonbi

texts.ru:
Тобонби работает поваром в маленькой столовой своего района Хуросон. Вот уже 21 год как она занимается обслуживанием людей. В основном она предлагает посетителям национальные блюда, которые у нее получаются очень вкусно. Посетители один раз пообедавшие у нее, становятся ее постоянными клиентами. 
Тобонби замужем, ей 50 лет. У нее две дочери и сын. Муж Тобонби работает мастером, оказывающим услуги по ремонту домов и эта работа у него сезонная. Поэтому основной доход семьи поступает за счет деятельности Тобонби. В данный момент для изготовления блюд в столовой ей не хватает немного денег. Она обратилась за кредитом и очень просит поддержать ее, чтобы она могла продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Tobonbi works as a chef in a small cafeteria in the Khuroson District. She has been serving people for 21 years already. She mainly offers ethnic Tajik food to customers, which she cooks very deliciously. After having lunch at her cafeteria just once, diners become her loyal customers.

Tobonbi is 50 years old and married. She has two daughters and a son. Tobonbi's husband works as a contractor, offering his home repair services. His work is seasonal. This is why the family's main income comes from Tobonbi's business. She currently does not have enough money to prepare dishes for her cafeteria. She is requesting a loan and is really asking you to support her so that she can continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to prepare dishes for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para tener los recursos económicos que le ayudaran a solventar los gastos que implica la recolección de la cosecha, tales como pago de mozos, alquiler de terreo, transporte y adquirirá insumos agrícolas para ir preparando todo lo necesario para su próxima siembra.
Con la inversión anterior pudo obtener una cosecha con granos de calidad, mayor producción, sus ingresos tuvieron un leve aumento, lo que le ha servido para cancelar sus deudas y continuar saliendo a delante junto  a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa has seen a need to apply for a new loan in order to have the necessary money to help her cover the costs of bringing in her harvest. She needs to pay for labourers, to rent land and transport and to buy farming supplies to prepare the land for her next batch of crops.

With her previous loan Rosa was able to harvest good quality grains and had a higher yield. Her income also saw a small increase, which helped Rosa to pay off her debts and continue moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to pay for labourers, to rent land and transport and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LA PRIMERA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de CD’s, venta de artefactos de limpieza, venta de ropa, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que ella al tener su pareja decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará en la feria comunal. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "La Primera" communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with "Pro Mujer" through the Patacamaya regional office. The group has eight members, and is directed by a board which has Delia as president. The members of this communal bank have businesses offering different products and services, including: selling meals, CDs, cleaning products and clothes, and growing potatoes.

This loan will benefit the small businesses in Delia's group. Delia herself tells us that this is her first time with "Pro Mujer" and that she joined following an invitation from one of the organisation's representatives, who went to visit her at home. Delia has a business selling vegetables. She says that her family had a similar business and that she and her partner decided to set up their own business.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying seeds in bulk. Delia will buy these seeds at the El Alto city's markets before growing the crops to sell later. This work allows Delia to earn a living and support her family; she has a partner and one son.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer" she answers that she likes the loans that are offered.

loans.use: to buy seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор проживает в районе Хуросон с семилетним сыном. Безработица заставила ее мужа покинуть семью, дом, родину и уехать на заработки в Россию. Сама Гулрухсор по профессии портниха и работает этим делом в течение 10 лет. Она принимает заказы у себя дома и шьет таджикские национальные платья. Гулрухсор шьет на старой ручной машинке, это отнимает у нее много времени. Она хочет приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку и расшить свою деятельность. Для этой цели Гулрухсор просит кредит. На сумму кредита она планирует купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку и ткани. Гулрухсор с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Gulrukhsor lives in the Khuroson District with her seven-year-old son. Unemployment forced her husband to abandon their family, their house and their country to go work in Russia. Gulrukhsor is a seamstress by trade and has worked in this business for 10 years. She takes orders in her home and sews ethnic Tajik dresses. Gulrukhsor sews on an old sewing machine which takes up a lot of her time. She wants to buy a modernized sewing machine and expand her business. This is they reason why she is requesting a loan. She plans to use the money from the loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine and fabric. Gulrukhsor hopefully awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Vaitosina

texts.en: Vaitosina is a 31-years-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, yams, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than six years. Vaitosia has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, an ax, a file, spades, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits Vaitosina hopes to improve her business and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, an ax, a file, etc

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, age 60, is married with four children. She lives with her spouse and children in a peaceful village, Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She operates a farm on a small plantation and grows rice to earn a living. To supplement her income, Im is engaged in selling porridge as breakfast in the morning and owns a retail store selling mixed products in her village. Through her efforts, she is able to earn a net profit of 20,000 KHR per day. Im has requested a loan to buy grocery products such as sweets, biscuits, packaged foods, snacks, food ingredients, beverages and other miscellaneous items to resell in her store. With this, she will be able to increase the volume of her sales, thus augmenting her income. In the future, Im dreams of expanding her farm and retail store so that each will generate more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as sweets, biscuits, packaged foods, snacks, food ingredients, beverages and other miscellaneous items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Anesa

texts.en:
Anesa previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different accessories like pony tail holders, coin purses, bonnets, and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and for her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy different accessories like pony tails holders, coin purses, bonnets, and other products needed in her business. The more items she displays, the better. More items to sell will result in increased profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anesa dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will not lack anything. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Charito has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for his daughter

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon is a borrower from Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is 39 years old and a mother of five children. Currently, only three of them are relying on her since they are in school. 

For a living, Sokhon does rice cropping and maize planting as the primary source of income and catching fish for resale as the secondary source of income. For ages, being involved in the current business, she is able to generate a decent income to support her business and the basic needs of her family. 

Sokhon is a former borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) who wisely utilized her loan to sustain her living and her business. 

However, she wants to focus on her son’s education for this cycle. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to pay for school fees for her son, who wants to achieve his dream of holding a bachelor degree, majoring in law. 

Sokhon hopes that she can provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her son.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45-years-old and married with one child.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, chips, bread, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Imelda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Muslim

texts.en:
Muslim lives in South Bogor, about 1 hour from Jakarta. Bogor is known as a rainy city. Muslim manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit. Muslim is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Muslim joined Ruma 4 months ago because he wants to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Muslim sees improvements in his shop. For the last 3 months, he has earned an average of $74-75 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal is to start more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Masrina

texts.en:
Masrina runs a small stall that sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Masrina is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Masrina began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $16 - $17 per day in sales (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малике 41 год. Она уроженка района Хуросон. Малика работящая сельская женщина, занимающаяся животноводством. У нее есть муж, двое сыновей, трое дочерей и уже два внука. Муж и старший сын предоставляют услуги по ремонту домов. А Малика на протяжении 10 лет занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она любит животных и любит ухаживать за ними. Сейчас Малика хочет увеличить поголовье скота. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить одного бычка. Она просит Вас поддержать ее.
texts.en: Malika is 41 years old. She is a native of the Khuroson District. Malika is a hard-working country woman who practices livestock breeding. She has a husband, two sons, three daughters and two grandchildren already. Her husband and eldest son provide home repair services. For the past 10 years, Malika has been raising cattle. She loves animals and loves to take care of them. Now Malika wants to increase the size of her herd. She is requesting a loan to buy a bull calf. She is asking you to support her.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS UNIDAS” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de mandiles, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, taller de tapicería, venta de productos secos (habas, arvejas, porotos, etc.).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucila es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos secos; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredó de su madre, quien vendía los mismos productos, desde ese entonces ella sigue comercializando estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arvejas y maíz pelado por mayor) que adquirirá de las provincias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

Una de las socias no se encuentra en la imagen por irse a una reunión con urgencia.
texts.en:
The “United Friends” Communal Bank has entered its 12th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, a part of the Santiago II Focal Center. The bank is composed of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors with Lucila as President.  The member's businesses are varied. Among them: sewing aprons, selling shoes or clothing, upholstery, and selling dry goods (broad beans, peas, green beans, etc.).

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-enterprises like Lucila's. She has belonged to Pro Mujer for 7 years and joined on the invitation of a friend who is a member. Lucila inherited her business from her mother who sold dry goods. Lucila sells the same products. 
 
She is requesting this loan to augment her capital and to purchase green peas and husked corn at wholesale. Lucila will acquire these in the city of La Paz and, subsequently, sell them at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate income for the family – she is married and has 3 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lucila responded that she especially likes the training the institution offers.

One member was absent from the original picture due to an urgent meeting.

loans.use: buy green peas and husked corn at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 36-year-old woman living in an area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine. He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles, such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renews the turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and, until this time, his business has been much settled. 

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some of his important tools have been tearing off and they urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected tools, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected.

Rehana's husband is a poor person and he does not have sufficient money to buy new tools for work. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy used tools to work over lathe machine. 

Rehana hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy used tools and cutting tools for turner work.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is age of 38, mother of four children, and living with her spouse and two daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He has been selling fresh fruit at a specific location from his cart in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruits business. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of fruit.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruit. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruit to sell from the cart at a specific location

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
Voern is 46 years old and married with four children living in a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moung Russey district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for 12 years. To add more income, she has been working as a paid worker. The current business earns them about 50,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 31,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
 
Voern’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. Voern successfully used the past loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use part of her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland and to use the rest of it to pay for labor. She hopes to grow her rice business successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani runs a small stall for tailoring and selling mobile phone airtime credits. Ani lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Ani is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Ani began working with Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months she has around $15 - 16 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 39, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste paper etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses he does not enough to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for earning an income.
Therefore, Samina has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after repayment of this loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale to factories.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 58 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ester has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Felisa has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулайым занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулайым, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 6 коз, также имеется 0,78 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перец, хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации.  Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян перца, помидоров и хлопка для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Гулайым намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование детей.
texts.en: Gulaiym is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulaiym practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 20 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulaiym's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 6 goats on her farm, as well as a 0.78 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows peppers, tomatoes, and cotton for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulaiym turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality pepper, tomato, and cotton seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Gulaiym is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Gulaiym plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cotton, tomato and pepper seeds, as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Phally is a 35-year-old married mother of five children, who are dependent on her. Four of her children are still in school, while another one is too young for school. To earn a living she has been buying and selling garbage and raising cows for 20 years. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 
Phally’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. The first loan has helped better support her family members. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phally wants to use her portion to buy more garbage for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more garbage for resale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thet's Group

texts.en:
Thet is 59 years old and widowed with one kid. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Pineapple growing has been her family’s main source of income for 20 years. She can earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs
. 
Thet’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and completely paid back her loans while her group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her family to have sufficient food and to better support the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her pineapples. She hopes to grow her pineapples fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her pineapple farm

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat is 49 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has four children. She has been farming rice and fishing. With the current business, she can earn approximately 50,000 KHR per day and save about 34,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
This is the seventh micro loan for Sophat with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sophat will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Pidor's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Pidor is 26 years and married with one child. To make a living and support her family, Pidor and her husband have been farming rice and selling fish as primary businesses for several years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.  
This is the second micro loan for Pidor with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Pidor will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
