Oun is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava, which she had been doing for 36 years. 

Oun requested a loan from VisionFund for 4,000,000 KHR, which she will use to pay the rental land fee in order to grow cassava. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the rental land fee in order to grow cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana de 61 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, Doña Juana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y poderle seguir dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old, and she's made her living sowing corn and beans for several years. When her crops are ready, she stores them in granaries, like those shown in the picture. She later sells to different markers nearby her house. With her earnings, she is able to cover some of her home expenses. She lives in a house she owns with her children.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc. to continue working on her crops and to keep providing her family with what they need with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он -Хамза из Таджикистана, женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, семян и ГСМ. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: He has difficult living conditions and a small income, but a kind heart and good character. His name is Hamza and he is from Tajikistan. He is married and is raising 4 children. For more than 10 years, he has been growing agricultural crops such as potatoes, wheat, carrots, etc. He sells the gathered harvest at the market. Because he has a high quality harvest, there is a great demand for his goods. His wife helps him run this business. In order to provide his family with all of the necessities, he wants to develop his business. In order to do this, he needs to receive a big harvest. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel. He plans to use the income from this business for his children's education and to improve their living conditions. He awaits and relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: La Bendición Group

texts.es:
La señora Fermina es de estado civil casada. De 40 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 7 hijos y no estan estudiando. Se dedica a comerciar maíz. Inició este negocio cuando se casó y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de maíz para revenderlo. Desea en el futuro contar con mayor capital de trabajao para poder ampliar su negocio.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.

En la fotografia aparecen 14 personas, pero, solo a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Fermina is 40 years and didn't have the chance to get an education. She is married with 7 children who are not in school, either. She buys and sells corn, and she started this business when she got married 10 years ago.

She is the group organizer and is requesting this loan to use to buy more corn for resell. In the future, she hopes to have better capital to expand her business.

The other members of the group make their living in sales and livestock businesses.

You can see 14 people in this picture, but only 10 of them will receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: Saeful

texts.en:
Saeful lives in West of Bandung, about three  hours from Jakarta. Saeful manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Saeful is married and lives with five people in the family home.

Saeful joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Saeful sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $20 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Tuduzikivi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe Tuduzikivi II et   habite à Cibitoke. Elle  a 50  ans et est mariée à  Stany, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés  de  7 à 17 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de riz, haricot, farine de manioc   depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilo de riz,de haricot, et de farine de manioc   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait  faire de l’élevage  et construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of the Tuduzikivi II Group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 50 years old and is married to Stany, a public official. Together they have five children, aged from 7 to 17 years, who are all in school. 

She has been trading rice, beans and cassava flour for 5 years. 

She is on her second loan cycle with Turame. With the credit she will obtain through KIVA she will increase her capital and buy many kilos of rice, beans and cassava flour for resale so she can earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to breed livestock and build a nice home.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy 100kg of rice, 100kg of beans and 50kg of flour for resale.

loans.name: Derry

texts.en:
Derry lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Derry manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Derry is single and lives with five persons in the family home.

Derry joined Ruma one month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With the assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Derry sees improvements in his shop.  For the last  month, he has earned an average of $5 - 6 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Sartika

texts.en:
Sartika lives in West of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Sartika manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Sartika is single and lives with three persons in the family home.

Sartika joined Ruma three months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sartika sees improvements in her shop.  For the last three months, she earns an average of $7 - 8 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Agus manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Agus is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Agus joined Ruma two months ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With the assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Agus sees improvements in his shop.  For the last  two months, he has earned an average of $43 - 44 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie, 52 years of age, married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She runs a direct selling business where she sells personal use products. Her net profits on her business are usually spent on their daily expenses in their house. Due to her insufficient funds, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase personal use products such as lotions, talc powder, make up, deodorant, and shampoo to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products such as lotions, talc powder, make up, deodorant, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is widow with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Hermenia has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tuzinduke Group

texts.fr:
Djuma  fait partie du groupe Tuzinduke  et   habite à Bujumbura. C’est un divorcé de 54 ans .Il a 6 enfants, âgés  de  7 à 17 ans,  dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,…)   depuis 5 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, hile de palme,...)    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait  augmenter son capital pour avoir un grand magasin et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Djuma is a member of the Tuzinduke Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is divorced and is 54 years old. He has 6 children, aged between 7 and 17 years old. 4 of his children are in school. 

He has been trading good in his shop (rice, beans, palm oil, etc) for 5 years. 

This is his eighth loan cycle with Turame. He will use the credit he gets through KIVA to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his shop (rice, beans, palm oil, etc) that he can sell to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to increase his capital in order to have a larger store and see his children study.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his store (rice, beans, palm oil, etc) for resale

loans.name: Sokkhoeurn

texts.en: Sokkhoeurn, aged 53, is a local farmer who is the breadwinner in her family consisting of three kids.  For her, two and a half hectares of cassava farm and one hectare of rice farm are the main source of her income, which generate her about 44,000 KHR per day after 13 years involvement in this business. Her past loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Successful repayment of her loan has helped her to grow and improve her business. For this cycle, she is seeking her second loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava and rice cropping business. She hopes to earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava and rice cropping business

loans.name: Sen Sek's Group

texts.en: Sen is a borrower from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 52 years old and is a married mother blessed with six children, one of whom is in school. To make a living, she does rice farming on three hectares of farmland and has a paid working job to supplement her income. She has been doing this for twenty years and it has returned her 30,000 KHR per day. This is the seventh cycle for Sen with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and has utilized it wisely to support her business. A decent income in return can improve her living as well as keep her kid in school. Now, she teams up in a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash for her crop. She hopes to boost her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Bwayi Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait parti du groupe Bwayi  et habite  à Cibitoke. Il a 38 ans et est marié   à Acquiline, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 3  à 13ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, banane, …) depuis 9 ans.

Il est à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'articles et en grande quantité (haricot, riz, banane, …) pour sa boutique, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Bwayi Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 38 years old and is married to Acquiline, a vegetable farmer. Together they have 4 children aged from 3 to 13 years, including 3 who are in school. 

He has been trading (beans, rice, banana, etc) from his store for 9 years. 

This is his second loan cycle with Turame. He will use the credit he obtains from Kiva to increase his capital and buy many items (beans, rice, banana, etc.) in large quantities for his store that he can sell to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children study

loans.use: increase his capital and buy large quantities of many items (beans, rice, bananas, etc) for his store for resale.

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Srean lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 33 years old and widowed with four children. To support her family, she has been working for about seven years as a farmer who grows cassava, and she supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 30,000 KHR each day after expenses.
 
Srean has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Dadan

texts.en:
Dadan lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Dadan is married and lives with six persons in the family home.

Dadan joined Ruma three months ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Dadan sees improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he has earned an average of $32 - $35 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru:
Абдусатор жизнерадостный молодой человек в возрасте 29 лет. Он пока не женат и живёт со своими родителями. Он очень трудолюбивый человек, и вот уже как 8 лет он работает мастером на мебельном цехе. На этой работе он получает небольшую заработную плату. Но скоро Абдусатор собирается жениться и для этого ему нужно копить денежные средства на свадьбу. Поэтому он решил заняться дополнительным бизнесом.

Для того, чтобы иметь хороший доход на проживание Абдусатор занимается своим любимым делом. Он подрабатывает  таксистом. По вечерам он выходит на дорогу, чтобы работать таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства. Поэтому Абдусатор обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdusattor is an optimistic young man, 29 years of age. He is not yet married and lives with his parents. He is a very hard-working person, and for over eight years he has been working as a foreman in a furniture factory. He receives a modes salary at that job. However, Abdusattor plans to get married soon, and so he needs to save up for his wedding. This is why he decided to take on additional work.

In order to have sufficient income for supporting himself, he does the work he enjoys most. He works as a taxi driver on the side. In the evening he gets in his car and provides taxi services. He has his own car for this purpose. But he has been driving this car for a long time, and had to repair it many times. This is why at present he would like to buy a different, better car in order to develop and grow his business. And, in order to buy a new car, he needs financial means. This is why Abdusattor has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy a car for his business. He is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Reap Lach's Group

texts.en: Sun, a resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 57 years old and a married mother of five children. Her entire family counts on the rice farming business and raising pigs that she has done for ages.  It currently generates her about 12,000 KHR per day. Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), she leads a big group of 8 people to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and fertilizer costs. She hopes that this loan will support her business in a timely way.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee and fertilizer cost.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Lia is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Lia joined Ruma four months ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Lia sees improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $10 - $20 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

Her goal for her business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Saepul

texts.en:
Saepul lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Saepul is single.

Saepul joined Ruma three months ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Saepul sees improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he has earned an average of $8 - $9 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Salmah

texts.en:
Salmah lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling medicines and mobile phone airtime credits. Salmah is single.

Salmah joined Ruma thee months ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Salmah sees improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $9 - $10 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

Her goal for her business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Deden

texts.en:
Deden lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling gasoline, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits.  Deden is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Deden joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Deden sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $5 - $6 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits.  Siti is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Siti joined Ruma one month ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Siti sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $15 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

Her goal for her business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Faatoa

texts.en: Faatoa is 22 years old, and married with two children.  She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, a frying pan and a new oven.  In the future, Faatoa hopes to use her business profits for her family and her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, a frying pan and a new oven.

loans.name: Leaia

texts.en:
Leaia is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Leaia has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and a file for her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. With her profit, Leaia hopes to save for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and a file

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
This is Timoteo, aged forty-five and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Reynaldo, an employee, and mother to his children. Together with his wife, Timoteo manages the household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Timoteo operates a cell phone retailing business. His business works as follows: he buys cell phone units from a supplier and then sells them for a small profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of mobile and cell phone units to expand his product inventory.

Timoteo hopes to be able to expand his business in the coming years. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mobile and cell phone units to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Shiela May

texts.en:
Shiela May is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Shiela May is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries during the harvest.

Shiela May has been farming sugarcane for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor during the harvest

loans.name: Urlina

texts.en:
Urlina works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Urlina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Urlina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Dufatanemunda Ii Group

texts.fr:
Francine  fait parti du groupe Dufatanemunda II et habite  à Cibitoke. Elle  a 23 ans et est mariée  à Laurent. Ensemble ils ont 2  enfants  âgés de  2 à 5 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce du haricot, du riz, des clous,... 5 depuis 9 ans.

Elle est à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de haricot, de riz, de clous,... à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Francine is a member of the Dufatanemunda II Group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 23 years old and is married to Laurent. Together they have 2 children aged from 2 to 5 years, including 1 who is in school. 

She has been trading beans, rice and cloves for 9 years. 

This is her second loan cycle with Turame. She will use the credit she obtains through Kiva to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice and cloves that she will sell to increase her profits. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children study

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice and cloves for resale

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Jelly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Cinta

texts.en:
Cinta lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling gasoline, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits.  Cinta is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Cinta joined Ruma 4 months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Cinta sees improvements in her shop. For the last 3 months, she has earned an average of $25 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

Her goal for her business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
Hendra lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Hendra manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Hendra is married and lives with four people in the family home.

Hendra joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff,  Usep sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $12 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and services bill payments. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Asep is single.

Asep began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

For the last month, he has had around $30 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). He took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions and bill payments using printer
